column2: sent to St. Luke's. ""In treatment"" there for several years. Sued 2004. Indicted on two counts of rape 2004
column3: not prosecuted because SOL expired. Found living at DC retirement home as of 5/10. Two claims included in Diocese's 11/08 $4.5M settlement with 59 plaintiffs. Dupre made a financial contrib. to settlement. Named in 2009 & 2010 suits as having reassigned perps who went on to abuse those plaintiffs. 2009 case settled 7/12.","Springfield, MA",MA,Source: Collection of Articles prior to 07.01.12

column1: Duran,Juan Carlos,1996,P,Sued,59BA3D32-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Extern priest from Colombia. Removed from Franciscan Order for child abuse. Became Dominican. Sued 2004. Accused of abuse of 1 boy. Also charged in 2004 of sexually abusing a boy in 1999-2002 in St. Louis and Chicago area starting at age 10. Believed tohave returned to Colombia. Laicized (possibly in 2001). Some reports state he was transferred to St. Louis after abuse in Memphis. Others state that he came from St. Louis. Civil suit settled 2/09 for $2M from diocese & order.,"Memphis, TN",TN,Source: Commercial Appeal 5.9.07

Durkin,Charles,1955,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Per 8/03 article, Durkin retired in 4/02 just after San Francisco DA's office requested church records related to years of allegations of abuse. He was the subject of a ""recent child molestation complaint"" stemming from conduct that allegedly occurredmore than 30 years ago. Received treatment at Southdown in 2002. No other info available. Died 4/18/06.","San Francisco, CA",CA,Source: San Francisco Chronicle 08.29.02

Durkin,Thomas J.,1964,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 8 mostly pre-teen boys from 1964-1966. Left active ministry 1968. Laicization announced 2005.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Archdiocese of Philadelphia Press Release

After the parents found out, they called their pastor who promised to take care of matters and offered counseling. Duvelsdorf gone from parish 2 days later. Served at several parishes before movingin 1991 to Palm Beach, FL and worked in parishes there. Arrested there in 1997 for public lewdness. Retired 2000. In 1995 the woman reached a $75K settlement with his superiors at St. Joseph's Abbey in MA. Woman sued the Monterey Diocese & school 12/03 for failing to prevent the abuse. Dwyer had receive numerous awards and honors for his writings. May still be active priest.","Monterey, CA",CA,Source: Bishop Ryan's Pastoral Letter 2.4.04

No information on victims or time of abuse.","Tucson, AZ",AZ,Source: Special Pastoral Report by Bishop Kicanas 03.27.03

column1: Dzermejko,David F.,1974,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Removed 6/09 within 48 hours after Diocese received allegation that he had sexually abused a minor approximately 19-20 yrs previously. Abuse is said to have occurred prior to Dzermejko's assignment to Mary Mother of the Church parish in Charleroi in approx 1991. He denied the allegation. 2nd allegation made after publicity re 1st. Review Board found allegation credible 8/10. File sent to Rome. Indicted 5/13 on Federal charges of possession of child porn. Pled guilty 11/7/13. Sentenced 4/25/14 to 3 yrs federal prison followed by 12 yrs probation. At sentencing, he denied sexual improprieties while a priest.","Pittsburgh, PA",PA,Source: Associated Press 06.08.82

At least one incident of abuse reported to Archdiocese in 1979 because there was a psychological report on Effinger addressed to Archbishop Weakland.7 men/2 women settled out of court with Archdiocese in 1994. Sentenced to 10 yrs jail in 1993 for molesting a 14 yr old boy in 1988. Died of cancer in prison 12/96. Some of personnel file released 7/13.,"Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Collection of articles prior to 2012

In 10/04 jury in civil suit found that he did not abuse the Plaintiff but also found that he was not slandered by either Plaintiff or Plaintiff's father. They then sued Bishop alleging a conspiracy to invade Plaintiff's privacy and prevent him from pursuing earlier suit. Dismissed by Ct. & upheld by OK Court of Appeals 1/14. 2nd accuser in 8/10 was unsubstantiated. Still active priest 2014.,"Tulsa, OK",OK,Source: Dallas Morning News 07.28.02

Longtime Notre Dame U. professor, known as founder of Latino theology in the U.S. Still in ministry 6/8/15.","San Antonio, TX",TX,Source: John Doe v San Antonio and Dominguez and Elizondo 05.22.15

In 2004 a man from Orlando filed a civil suit . 2nd civil suit filed 2/08 in Florida alleged a long-term relationship with Emerson, beginning at age 9. Suit filed in Ind. 12/08 alleging abuse after Emerson returned to Gary. Laicized in 2006. New FL suits filed 5/10 & 7/10. He filed bankruptcy 2/11.","Orlando, FL",FL,Source: Indianapolis Star 1.2.05
Emo,Eugene G.,1961,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Arrested 2/96

In 1999 he was charged with violating probation by having contact with 16 year old boy and was sentenced to 1-3 years in prison. Released from prison in 2002. Involuntarily dismissed from clerical state per 6/7/12 statement from Diocese.,"Rochester, NY",NY,Source: Associated Press 5.9.97

Engel,Ronald,1977,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Engel placed on leave in late April, 2004 after Archdiocese learned that he was subject of police investigation because of possession of child pornography on a computer. column1: Engelhardt,Charles F.,1977,P,Charged,49A766B2-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Named in report and presentment by Philadelphia Grand Jury on 2/10/11. Accused, along with another priest and a teacher, of orally sodomizing and molesting a 10 yr old boy in 1998 or 1999 at St. Jerome Parish in Philly. Remained at another parish for2 yrs after 2009 complaint and order from Archdiocese to leave assignment. Surrendered to police 2.10.11. Refused plea agreement 6/11. New civil suit filed 7/11. Criminal trial started 1/7/13. Defendants did not testify. Found guilty 1/30/13. Arrested. Request for new trial filed with Penn. Superior Court 7/14 by counsel for Engelhardt and for teacher Bernard Shero based on new evidence about a new witness who could have supported Defense and discredited the main witness.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Collection of Articles through 01.21.13

In 10/06 he was sentenced to 2 terms of 1.5 yrs in Dubois County Jail. Rec'd another 3 yrs in 2/07. Released 1/08. On sex offender registery. Not in compliance 2/10. Listed as on ""administrative leave"" per diocesan website 2/2/09.","Evansville, IN",IN,Source: Evansville Courier & Press 08.12.05

column1: Ernsdorff,Harold H,1943,P,Accused,632DDDD6-AF88-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"As part of Section 13.1, Non-Monetary Commitments, of the Society of Jesus, Oregon Province, Reorganization Plan (dated 7/18/11) the province agreed to post on its website the names of all members of the province who are identified as perpetrators ofsexual abuse in proofs of claims filed in the bankruptcy case, and who have not denied the allegation. Ernsdorff's name is included on this list without any additional information on claims against him. Worked in San Francisco, Seattle, and Baker dioceses. Died 8/21/58.","Baker, OR",OR,Source: FindAGrave 08.21.58

column1: Ernst,David A.,1954,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Allegedly, at one point he worked at Our Lady Help of Christians parochial school in East Orange as boys' sex education teacher. Multiple accusers have come forward in the past as well as in 2010. At least one claim against Ernst (who died 3/26/88) was included in 10/04 $1M settlement between Archdiocese and individuals who claimed abuse by 9 priests. Ernst also served in parishes in Rutherford, Wyckoff and Ridgefield Park.","Newark, NJ",NJ,Source: Cranford Citizen & Chronicle 05.20.54

Etzel,George A.,1942,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Etzel retired in 1984 and died in 2003 at age 85. column1: Evans (in Colo),Timothy Joseph,1993,P,convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Charged with two counts of sexual abuse. 3 male victims. Abuse occurred 1995-1997 and 1999. Removed from active ministry in 2003. Judge will allow other accusers to testify. Has pleaded innocent to all charges. Found guilty in 1 trial in 03/07 and then found guilty in another county in 2nd trial in 04/07. Named in 1st civil suit 4/07. Sentenced to 14 yrs to life 5/07 with 4 more years added 1 day later in another case. Suit settled 4/08.,"Denver, CO",CO,Source: TheDenverChannel.com 12.01.05

Ewing,Bruce O.,1974,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Left priesthood in 1977. Civil suit filed 4/02. Also charged 2003 with abuse of Plaintiff in early 1970s. She claimed a consensual relationship beginning when she was age 14 but he denied any relationship. Civil suit settled through mediation 3/03. Criminal trial ended in mistrial 2004. New criminal trial held 3/07 and jury found him guilty of 1 count on 3/22/07. Sentenced to 5 yrs probation 5/07. Laicized 2004. Led parish council in 2010
column2: terminated 2/11. On Sex Offender Registry.,"Louisville, KY",KY,Source: Courier Journal 9.2.04

column1: Fairbairn,Frank E.,1969,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Fairbairn died 9/2000 after 31 yrs as a priest. Left position as chaplain at Northeastern Univ. to go to Peru and work as priest from 1994 to 1999. Per 1/03 articles, Fairbairn was named as abuser for first time in recent lawsuit. He was accused of abusing one man, then 14, in 1970. 8/11 Boston AD database reports no formal determination of guilt either because he died prior to canonical investigation or it was not complete at his death.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 09.15.00

column1: Fallert,"Francis ""Frank"" J.",1952,P,Sued,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Plaintiffs filed 43 suits 1/09 against Jesuit Order and its former provincial alleging that Order knew of abusive priests in Alaska and did nothing to stop them. One woman in the suit alleged abuse by Fallert at St. Michael's Church in 1956-1957. Died 6/90. Two or more pending claims shown in bankruptcy reorganization documents for Fairbanks Diocese 1/25/10.,"Fairbanks, AK",AK,"Source: USA Today 06.08.90

column1: Falvey,Arthur A.,< 1930,P,Settled,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 6/09, Jesuits settled claim by one man who alleged that Falvey raped him repeatedly over a four year period, beginning in 1954 when he was 7. Falvey was assigned to St. Ignatius Church in Sacramento at the time. He died in 1966. This was only accusation against him. Falvey is the brother of Fr. Mark Falvey who abused at least 10 children in CA and was the subject of a 2007 settlement by the Jesuits.","Sacramento, CA",CA,Source: Sacramento Bee 06.05.09 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

Falvey,Mark A.,1928,P,Accused,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2002 & 2003, 3 people accused him of abuse in 1950s-1960s. Named in at least 1 civil suit. Accused of abusing at least 10 children between 1959 and his death in 1975. Tentative settlement of $16 mil reached between 9 plaintiffs and Jesuit order in May, 2007. Two other claims remain unresolved. Brother of Fr. Arthur Falvey who also was accused of abuse in 2009 settlement of a separate case.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 4

Farabaugh,Kenneth,1963,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Archdiocese learned of allegations from 3rd party in 1993. Individual denied making the accusations and Farabaugh also denied so matter dropped. In 2000 the same individual met with archdiocese and provided detailed allegations of sexual abuse. Farabaugh was under investigation by police & diocese at time of his death in car accident in Dec. 2000 (his car ran off the road and struck a tree). Name appeared on Baltimore's 9/26/02 list of abusers.,"Baltimore, MD",MD,Source: Baltimore Sun 12.13.00

Farmer,Donald G.,1963,P,Arrested,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Left priesthood in late 1960s and was laicized in 1972. Was working as marriage and family counselor in 2003 when he was arrested for 1966 abuse of 4 preteens. Charged with 14 felony counts. Charges dismissed in 2003 when CA law was overruled by Supreme Court. Named in at least 3 civil suits.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: San Bernardino Sun 02.26.03

column1: Farris,"John V. ""Jack""",1949,P,Sued,56BD77EF-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Attended St. John's seminary in Kansas City and worked in nine Missouri parishes. Spent 7 yrs at St. John Seminary and/or Queen of Angels Seminary in CA. Sued 2003 in California. Accused of abuse of 1 youth from 1951-1954. Also worked in Denver. Died2003. Personnel file released 09/09/13. Major issues with alcoholism throughout entire career. Also worked in Cape Girardeau and Perryville, MO. Personnel file released 10/26/13.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: The Wander 01.08.04

column1: Farwell,Richard B.,1981,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Indicted 8/02 on charges that he took indecent liberties with boy in mid-1980s. Diocese learned of charges in 1999. Farwell went to work at Food for the Poor in FL in 2000 with letter of reference from Bishop Curlin because he felt charges were not credible. Faculties were revoked 4/02. Officially still attached to Charlotte Diocese. Pleaded no contest to charges 11/04
column2: sentenced to 180 days probation, counseling & community service. Civil suit filed 7/19/11. Diocese wants suit dismissed on SOL 2/11/12. Court ruled 6/20/14 that the suit was filed too late and dismissed the case on SOL. Appeal is possible.","Charlotte, NC",NC,Source: Sun-Sentinel 04.18.02

Abuse began in 1975 and ended in mid-1980s. Allegations first reported 12/01. Died 5/04. Name is also on 2003 Archdiocesan list of abusers","Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Archdiocesan Report 3.20.06 page 2

Fatooh,Charles George,1985,B,Sued,4EAA0E17-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in one 2006 suit of abuse of one student in 1973-74 at Chaminade College Prep in Canoga Park, where he was later principal. Left the Marianists and was ordained a priest on 8/24/85 for the Monterey diocese, where he became monsignor, Chancellor, and Moderator of the Curia. Still listed as an active priest at St. Joseph church in Cayucos in the 2010 Monterey Directory. Marianist personnel file released 7/13 as part of 2007 LA settlement.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

Some of his personnel files released 7/13 reference ""his problem"" or ""difficulty."" Buried at Saint Gregory Abbey Cemetery in Shawnee, OK.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: Behind the Pine Curtain - nd

Woman filed suit 12/02 alleging that he abused her as a teen in 1970s. Said he provided her and others with alcohol and marijuana. Settled 2003. Files released 2/03 say church knew in 1980 that Fay had been arrested in NH for ""drunkeness and use of narcotics"" and that there were other allegations of misbehavior with youths. Involuntary laicization announced 2/12/05.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Middlesex Court case file 2002-02685

Add'l claim(s) settled 2003. Laicization announced 5/03. New suit filed in 2010 by convicted rapist who alleged abuse in 1976-1977.","Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: Associated Press 8.5.99

column1: Feeney,John Patrick,1952,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Removed 1986. 18 parishes in 30 yrs. Convicted 2004. Sentenced 15 yrs prison--served 8. Released 11/11. Jury found Diocese committed fraud and awarded plaintiffs $700K. They dropped punitive damages claims. New Trial set for 5/13
column2: settled 3/13 for $700K. Another trial in NV 10/12. $500K against Green Bay. Diocese appealed

column1: Feeney,Thomas J.,1937,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sued at least twice. Accused of abuse in 1950s-1960s. Former vicar general of diocese
column2: died 1981. Diocese admitted in 5/06 that allegations were credible. 4 additional suits filed 5/06. Civil trial began in 9/06 in a suit filed in 2005. Man testified that Feeney abused him for 6 years, beginning when he was about 6. Jury awarded Plaintiff $1.5M. Total of 15 accusers known with earliest date of abuse 1957.","Davenport, IA",IA,"Source: KTIV 9.6.06

column1: Feit,John B.,1959 ?,P,Convicted,768B4B79-AF88-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 1962 he pleaded no contest to reduced charge of aggravated assault for grabbing a young woman in church in 1960. Shortly after the 1960 assault, he became prime suspect in rape/murder of another young woman in McAllen, TX. Never indicted (even after another grand jury investigation in 2004). Feit worked at Paraclete facility in N.M. for several years and placed many abusers in outside positions. Left order in 1972 and married.","Brownsville, TX",TX,Source: Dallas Morning News 07.13.02

Feiten,John Richard,1948,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Following a recent court order, on 12/16/13 Bp. Quinn released a list of 13 names of priests who had ""credible"" accusations of abuse involving minors. Feiten's inclusion on this list is the first public notice that he had been accused of abuse. He retired from active ministry 6/00 and died 7/9/01. After his death, two separate complaints of abuse of minor boys were received against Feiten. Abuse in 1969 was reported in 2002 and a second, undated complaint was made in 04/06.","Winona, MN",MN,Source: Anderson & Assoc Press Release 12.16.13

Archdiocese announced 5/4/12 that allegations were substantiated and he will be permanently removed from active ministry. column1: Fernandez,Federico,,P,Settled,47A15D80-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"1988 suit claims Fernandez abused two boys. Church promised to investigate and asked parents to keep quiet. Sent Fernandez for treatment. Suit is sealed. Older brother of victims says he was abused by same priest. Previously arrested for public indecency. Criminal charges dismissed. Civil suit settled 7/88, reportedly for more than $1M. In 2002 man says he told Archbishop Flores in 1983 about seeing Fernandez naked in a swimming pool with two girls aged 10 and 11. Active priest 5/11 in Bogota, Colombia. One alleged victim who said Fernandez molested and raped him as a 5th grader was convicted of rape and murder in 1995
column2: he was executed in 2011 by the State of Texas. Fernandez working in 2015 it Universidad de San Buenaventura in Cartagena. Also posts ""Sunday Reflections"" on a Bogota church's website.","San Antonio, TX",TX,Source: United Press International 02.19.88

column1: Fernando,Arthur (Arturo) N.,,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 between 1973-1975. Named in at least 1 civil suit.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

Fernando,Walter,1973,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Ordained in 1973 in Sri Lanka. Temp. priest in Los Angeles 1981. Incardinated in LA 1986. Sued 2003. Shown as ""absent on leave"" in the 1988 Catholic Directory but does not appear in the 1990 edition.","Cleveland, OH",OH,Source: Akron Beacon Journal 04.09.02

Ferrario (Bp),Joseph,1951,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Ordained a priest of the Sulpician order in in 1951 and started his career in Mountain View, CA. Moved to Hawaii in 1957 and became bishop in 1982. Accused in 1985 of abuse of 15 yr old boy beginning in 1975. 1991 civil suit dismissed due to SOL. Allegations ""found to be groundless by an internal church investigation."" He retired in 1993, and died 2003. New civil suit filed 2012 re abuse in 1973. He reported to Diocese in 1991 but nothing done. Named in three suits filed in 2013. Also named in new 2014 suit re abuse of one in 1968 or 1969 after youth told him he had been abused by Fr William Queenan.","Honolulu, HI",HI,"Source: Washington Times 11.06.89

column2: convicted and sentenced 5/20/04 to life in prison for repeatedly raping boy 1973-80 in Billerica MA starting at age 7. Admitted at trial he was pedophile who abused perhaps dozens of boys. Earliest abuse alleged in civil suits was 1964-68.Then he was in FL as Navy chaplain 1968-71
column4: sued 1/06 for FL abuse. Reassigned, he allegedly abused in Brooklyn, Rockville Centre, St. Louis, and Metuchen dioceses. Suspended 1988. Diocese apparently knew much earlier.","Brooklyn, NY",NY,Source: Collection of Sources 1981-2006

Freddy),1942,P,Settled,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Woman filed suit 10/08 against Jesuits alleging abuse by Ferreti in 1970s, beginning when she was 8 and he was assigned to Lapwai Catholic Church, Nez Perce. Included on the Helena diocese's list posted to its website 4/29/15 in compliance with the non monetary terms of the 3/5/15 bankruptcy settlement.","Boise, ID",ID,"Source: KLEW 10.14.08

May have had conviction expunged after he finished probation. Worked at Tribunal from 1987 to 2002. Listed as abuser in 2003 but not accused by any of plaintiffs. At least 8 people have accused him of abuse. He was 1 of 6 accused abusers assigned to Santa Clara Parish in Oxnard. Personnel file released 1/13. Laicized 12/19/07.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,"Source: LA Times 08.18.02

column1: Fiala,John M.,1984,P,Sued,2D65DC41-AF88-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Ordained in Omaha. Joined SOLT Order 1996. Worked in MO, KS, & TX. Privileges removed 10/08 after allegations of abuse in San Antonio Archdiocese. 4/10 TX suit alleged Fiala raped 16 yr old boy at least twice in 2007-2008. In 4/10, Omaha said it knew in 2002 of sexual advances toward a minor in mid-1980s. Indicted 8/10 in TX. Arrested 9/3/10 in KS
column2: returned to TX. Released on bail. Settlement of lawsuit w/ San Antonio and Omaha archdiocese, Corpus Christi Diocese and Order 01/2011. Re-arrested in Dallas 11/18/10 for trying to hire hit-man to kill accuser. Convicted in Dallas on solicitation of murder 5/17/12. Sentenced to 60 yrs prison.","Omaha, NE",NE,Source: Link to Articles prior to 05.01.12

column1: Fichtner,Robert C.,1955,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"One man filed suit 1/05 alleging Fichtner abused him at St. Joseph's school when he was a young boy. Fichtner retired in 2002
column2: placed on leave 2003 when the allegations were made. In 6/05 Archdiocese lifted all restrictions after review board could not verify the allegation.Retired 2002. Prior to retirement, Fichtner was a member of the College of Consultors for Archdiocese. Died June 7, 2013.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Patriot Ledger 03.08.05

column1: Finegan,Paul J.,1970,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in 1980 of abusing 2 girls
column2: renewed complaint in 1989 regarding same girls, including details of skin-to-skin sexual touching and names of 3 other possible victims
column3: treated at Southdown and returned to ministry
column4: removed in 2002 after nun reported to Cardinal Law that a ""credible young man"" had said he had been abused as a minor. ""Voluntarily"" laicized 2005. Last known to be living in Randolph. In 2009 another woman filed police report which alleged abuse when she worked in rectory as a young teen.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Selected Boston archdiocesan documents
column13: The Patch 09.02.11 Assignments:Boston archdiocesan assignment record

column1: Fitz-Henry,Edward,1985,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Ordained in Ireland. Worked in Monterey for over 20 yrs. Removed after complaint of abuse at Madonna Del Sasso parish received 1/11. More info received on allegation of abuse involving a minor made approx 20 yrs previously. Review Board found earlier allegation to be credible. Civil suit filed 2/15/11 by recent accuser. He denied all allegations. Civil suit settled 2/12 for $500K. Fitz-Henry also sued Diocese 2/12. Settled 3/13. Has left priesthood and requested laicization. Docs to be released 01/14..,"Monterey, CA",CA,Source: Collection of Articles prior to 04.15.11

Fitzgerald,J. Vincent,1950,P,Sued,DBD23903-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"One of several accused in 2010 suit against Sioux City Diocese, Oblates & Sisters of the Divine Savior re abuse at Tekakwitha Indian Mission, Sisseton SD. Man and woman alleged sexual abuse late 1960s. Suit dismissed on SOL. Worked in Duluth diocese various times 1957-1983 and Crookston and New Ulm diocese. Named in civil suits filed 11/19/13 and 2/14 against Crookston Diocese, New Ulm & Oblates. One accuser known in Crookston. Named on 12/31/13 Duluth list. Included on New Ulm list released by Atty Jeff Anderson 08/04/14. Names from deposition of Rev. Francis Garvey, former top New Ulm Diocese official, taken 1/14. Judge ordered Crookston diocese 8/15 to turn over to ""John Doe 19"" all records of sexual abuse by priests prior to 1985. Doe 19 claimed sexual abuse as boy by Fitzgerald mid-1980s in Naytahwaush MN, on White Earth Indian Reservation. Civil trial scheduled 10/15 in case of alleged abuse in Duluth diocese in 1978 of boy who had met Fitzgerald in New Ulm diocese.","Sioux Falls, SD",SD,"Source: FindAGrave 09.27.09

column1: Fitzgerald,John D.,1933,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Fitzgerald served as pastor at Ascension Church in Oak Grove, from 1951-1973. Woman contacted the Archdiocese in 2005 to report that she was sexually abused by him in 1964 when she was a teenage parishioner. Fitzgerald died in either 1984 or 1986. No public information released about Fitzgerald's abuse until the woman finally came forward at a 7/31/14 news conference after her mother, a diocesan employee, had passed away. The Archdiocese did pay for counseling for her.","Chicago, IL",IL,Source: SNAP Press Release 07.31.14

Fitzgerald,Matthew,1968,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse of 1 teenage boy in Rockville Centre diocese in mid-1980s. Transferred to Palm Beach, Fl diocese in 1989. At least 4 separate allegations in parishes in Florida. Privileges removed by Palm Beach diocese in 2002. Named in 2003 civil suitin New York. Also sued in Florida. Identified as Priest B in the Suffolk Co Grand Jury Report","Rockville Centre, NY",NY,Source: Tribune 2.7.10
column14: Sun-Sentinel 12.04.04 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record and Other Info

column1: Fitzharris,Joseph L.,1962,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Removed 1991. Accused of abuse. Criminally convicted in 1987. Resigned from priesthood 1/95. Archdiocese settled at least one claim in 5/07 $6.65M settlement with 14 people alleging abuse by 12 priests. Another man settled his claims for $875K in 7/07 just prior to filing suit. He had alleged abuse in 1970s between ages of 7-10. Laicized 5/09. Additional settlement with at least one man announced 8/30/11. Personnel file released 1/14 as part of that settlement.,"Chicago, IL",IL,"Source: Chicago Archdiocesan Report rev 2009
column17: National Catholic Reporter 01.23.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record"

column1: Fitzpatrick,James J.,1954,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Ordained for Dallas / Fort Worth Diocese in 1954.. Only known assignment for Fort Worth was at Sacred Heart Catholic Church (Wichita Falls): 1969-1973. Accused of abuse in 1967-1968 in Los Angeles. Described as Extern priest from Texas working in Archdiocese. Died 8/6/73.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 4 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

column1: Fitzpatrick,Thomas Q.,1976,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 individual in 1987.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 1 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

Fletcher,William J.,1944 ?,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Per 7.26.06 article, woman had just filed suit alleging abuse by Fletcher at St. Margaret Mary Alacoque Parish in Shelton in early 1960s, beginning when she was a 7 yr old girl. He died in April, 1988. Diocese says that there have been no other allegations against him.","Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: Connecticut Post 07.26.06 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

Flood,J. Michael,1968,P,Suit Withdrawn,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Suit filed 9/09 in DE accused Flood of abuse of youth at St. John Neumann H.S. in late 1970s. Archdiocese let him continue as Pastor since Plaintiff's identity not known. He denied allegation
column2: agreed to avoid unsupervised ministry to youth. One of 21 priests placed on leave 3/7/11 pending investigation re allegations of sexual abuse of minors. Suit withdrawn 12/11 after inconsistencies in Plaintiff's deposition. In 5/12 Archdiocese found allegations unsubstantiated & found him suitable for ministry.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Archdiocese of Philadelphia Press Release 3.8.11

column2: Boston Globe 08.10.02 Assignments:BA.org Brief Assignment Record

column1: Flores,Alejandro (Alex),2009,P,Arrested,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Native of Bolivia
column2: ordained for Joliet 6/09. Removed 1/4/10 from First Family after parents accused him of abusing 13 yr old son for 5 yrs while seminarian. Attempted suicide1/6/10 by leaping from balcony of abandoned church. Received serious head injuries. Released 1/20/10 and arrested. Charged 4/10 with attempted abuse of 1st victim's brother. Pled guilty 9/10 to 1st allegations. 4 yrs prison. Paroled 6/13 but arrested by Immigration. Deported to Bolivia 8/6/13. Out-of-court civil settlement 2012.,"Joliet, IL",IL,Source: Bolingbrook Sun 01.07.10
column20: Joliet Diocese List of Priests with Credible Allegations 03.12.13
column37: Diocese of Joliet List of Priests with Credible Allegations 04.30.14 Assignments:St. Charles Republican 4.30.10 (add'l article)

column1: Flosi,James Vincent,1971,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Sued 2005. Accused of abuse of 1 Quigley Theological Seminary student in 1980 while assigned to Holy Name Cathedral. Resigned from priesthood 7/92. Later became founder and CEO of Aidscare in Chicago. Laicized 10/10.,"Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Archdiocesan Report accessed 7.5.11

column1: Flynn, Jr.,John H.,1955,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in 1/03 civil suit of fondling a 6-year-old girl in 1978. Flynn denied the accusation.Settled by arbitration with the archdiocese in 2003. Reinstated in 10/05 by archdiocese, which stated that the allegation could not be substantiated. See 8/11 Boston AD database. Died 1/30/11.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.30.03
column7: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Flynt,James M.,1985,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,No allegations at St. Dominic Parish 1987-1989 but staff requested his removal. Known for inappropriate expressions of affection for young men. Legal guardian of 6th grade boy. Removed 2001. Name on Archdiocese's 7/9/04 list of priests fully restricted from ministry because of credible allegations of abuse. Name not found in 2002 Catholic Directory but he did preside at a funeral 4/02. Shown as laicized per Archdiocesan list updated 11/26/07. Laicization date 6/24/04 per personnel file released 7/13.,"Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Statement by Archdiocese of Milwaukee 07.09.04
column4: Archdiocese of Milwaukee List of Clergy Offenders 03.03.12

column1: Foley,George,1963,P,Sued,54A19CCD-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Ordained in Ireland. Accused in 2002 of abuse of 1 girl from 1971-1974 while he was sexually involved with her mother. Archdiocese knew in 1974 of allegations re involvement w/ women. Left Order and Archdiocese in 1974. Named in 1 civil suit 2003,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 4 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

Foley,James D.,1960,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sent to the Calgary diocese because of a relationship with a 19-year-old woman. Calgary sent Foley back to Boston in 1968 after more trouble with the woman and ""others."" Foley admitted to Law and McCormack in 1993 that he had fathered two children with a woman and later abandoned her during a fatal drug overdose. But Foley continued to serve until the notes of that meeting were revealed in 12/02. Shortly thereafter Law resigned. Wrongful death suit settled 2004.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Documents from Foley's Personnel File
column6: Patriot Ledger 10.20.08 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Foley,James J.,1978,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Personnel file released 12/02 showed Foley was placed on leave in 1999 for allegedly fondling a 14-yr old boy's genitals under pretense of measuring him for bodybuilding training. Foley claimed he was guilty only of ""gross stupidity and indiscretion."" Banned from ministering to minors in 2000. On administrative leave with canonical case in progress as of 9/12. 2nd man came forward 2011 to Archdiocese to allege abuse at Holy Name from 1984 or 1985 to 1996. His accusations made public 9/12. In 10/15 status is ""Administrative Leave
column2: Case in Process.""","Boston, MA",MA,"Source: Boston Globe 12.12.02
column12: The Bulletin, West Roxbury-Roslindale 09.13.12 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record (enhanced with links to multiple documents)"

column1: Foley,Robert,,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Per 2002 report, in 1985, Michael Driscoll, then chancellor of Orange diocese, now Bishop of the Diocese of Boise, wrote to a priest in Liverpool, England, begging him to take Foley. Foley had just admitted to molesting an 8 yr old boy during a camping trip organized by St. Justin Martyr. Boy's mother threatened to go to the police and Foley was in jeopardy of arrest and possible imprisonment in he stayed in U.S. Foley left for England and never faced prosecution for the molestation. Civil suit settled","Orange, CA",CA,Source: OC Register 5.4.93

Foley,Stephen C.,1967,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Named in multiple civil suits by men claiming abuse when they were teenagers. Often used his position as fire and police chaplain to meet victims and to lure them into relationships. One man's father reported Foley to the diocese in 1960s. Not removed by archdiocese until 1993 after one man told police. Removed from position as state police chaplain around the same time. $500K settlement 3/07. $600K settlement 3/08. $750K settlement 1/09. Total of 13 settlements in all.,"Hartford, CT",CT,Source: Hartford Courant 03.31.01

Ford,James H.,1973,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Civil suit filed 2/12 alleges that Ford abused one youth in 1970s. He worked as associate pastor in 3 parishes in Kansas City area between 1973 - 1983, completed an advanced degree and then worked for a religious training center for adults until 1986 when he resigned from ministry. Died in 1992, possibly of AIDS. One accuser went to diocese in 1995. Accepted counseling and settlement. Unable to determine if plaintiff in 2012 suit is same individual.","Kansas City-St. Joseph, MO",MO,Source: KCTV 02.10.12
column2: Kansas City Star 02.23.12 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Ford,James Michael,1966,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 14-yr-old boy from 1968-1971 at Orange Co. Mater Dei High School and Holy Family per suit in L.A. Archdiocese investigated and found no basis for allegation. Accuser received $225K from Orange Diocese and more from LA. Accuser told ABp Malony of many other victims. Sent to Santa Barbara in 1971 even after accuser told two priests (both accused abusers) about the abuse. Did not retire until 6/05. Faculties removed 2006 & restored 2008. Died 5/22/11. Personnel file released 1/13.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,"Source: John Roe 4 vs. Does, Cause No. 1156450, Superior Court of California
column11: Los Feliz Ledger 02.28.13 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Forrester,John C. (Fidelis),1954,P,Sued,42C6FE9C-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Listed on the Davenport IA Diocese's 7/08 list of accused priests with credible allegations against him involving 3 minor males beginning in 1955. Several 2002 & 2003 suits in Seattle accused Forrester of abuse of boys in mid 1970s on church outings and overnight trips. Died in 2002. 7 plaintiffs participated in $2.6M settlement in 2005 re St. Benedict's Abbey, Kansas City KS archdiocese. Also settlement 11/06 re Seattle claims. New suit 12/10.","Davenport, IA",IA,Source: Benedictine Priests in the Davenport Diocese 1960-1965
Forry,Thomas P.,1966,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 1984, therapists suggested that Forry be sent for long-term hospitalization and treatment
column2: he refused to go. Even though Archdiocese knew of allegations of sexual abuse and beatings of preteen boy by Forry and affairs with women, he was allowed to serve as army chaplain from 1988-1992. See history in personnel file. Abuse matter settled for $30K 12/93. Placed on leave in 2002. Laicized in 2006. Lives in South Boston 10/08. Boston AD database in 8/11 says case concluded canonically.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 02.08.02
column14: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Forster,Albert J.,1926,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of several boys in 1960s. Died 1990. Named in at least 2 civil suits filed against diocese in 2004. Suits settled in 2004 and 2005.,"Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: Globe Gazette 01.05.06
column6: Telegraph Herald 03.07.06 Assignments:Archdiocesan Report on Assignments and Other Info 9.22.06

column1: Fortier,Roger Armand,1980,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,By 1984 Fortier had admitted to Chancellor that he watched pornographic filmes and gave alcohol to minor boys and then abused them. Arrested 1997 for molesting 2 boys at the rectory in mid 1990s. Also charged with possession of child porn. Convicted 7/98 and sentenced to 30 to 60 years in prison for abuse of two youths. Pled guilty 11/97 to attempted abuse of a 3rd youth and rec'd concurrent 5-10 yr sentence. Other victims came forward 2002 & 2003. Still in prison 5/11.,"Manchester, NH",NH,Source: Boston Globe 8.8.98
column2: Documents from NH Atty General Report 3.3.03
column3: Manchester Report from NH Atty General 3.3.03

column1: Fortner,Douglas F.,1970,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Placed on leave in Nov. 2006 after ""credible allegation"" of sexual abuse of a child dating back at least 25 years. Diocese is continuing its investigation.","Covington, KY",KY,Source: WCPO 11.19.06

Foster,Michael Smith,1980,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Top Canon lawyer in Archdiocese. Accused in 8/02 lawsuit of abusing a man when he was a teenager in 1980s. Suspended from duties. After number of people raised serious doubts leveled about veracity of the accuser, the man dropped the case. Law first agreed to reinstate Foster
column2: then withdrew. Reinstated 11/02. investigation reviewed 9/03. Living in FL as of 6/07. No restrictions. See 8/11 Boston AD database re accused priests.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 9.4.02

column1: Fox,John P.,1927,P,Accused,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,One pending claim against Fox shown in bankruptcy reorganization documents for Fairbanks Diocese 1/25/10. Worked in Hooper Bay parish from 1931-1946 and in Pilot Station parish between 1946-1965. Worked at St. Mary's Mission under James Poole from 1963-1964. Died 1983.,"Fairbanks, AK",AK,Source: BA Assignment Record of James Poole

column1: Fraga,Bento R.,1956,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Fraga retired in 2005 but still assisted in various duties. In Jan. 2008 Diocese received report that he had molested one minor on one occasion in 1979 at Holy Ghost Parish. He denied all allegations. After investigation, the Review Board found the allegations credible. His removal from Ministry was announced 3/16/08. As of 4/08, accuser had decided not to press criminal charges. at that time. Died 4/8/12.","Fall River, MA",MA,Source: Obituary from Manuel Rogers & Sons Funeral Home 4.8.12

Fratic,Joseph P.,1964,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"One man filed suit 2/04 alleging that he was molested by Fratic, then at St. Paul's in Cambridge, after another priest lured him to Fratic's home. Suit says the other priest, Paul Hurley (another accused abuser), gave the 13 yr old boy porno and alcohol and Fratic molested him on one occasion. Privileges removed 2004 by the Archdiocese. Still on administrative leave as of 9/15 and canonical proceedings are still in process per Boston AD database.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 02.06.04
column4: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Frazier,Richard,1996,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Removed 1/06 after allegations of abuse by Frazier in late 1970s-early 1980s prior to his ordination. Allegations were made as part of settlement of class action suit against Diocese. Frazier denied all the allegations. Initial reports show that at least one allegation occurred in late 1990s after his ordination.,"Covington, KY",KY,Source: Community Recorder 01.12.06

Freitas,Robert E.,1972,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sent for treatment and placed on ""restricted ministry"" in 1985 after two boys complained of sexual abuse. In 2002, man told Diocese Freitas had molested him in 1979. Police notified. Plaintiff wore a wire during meeting
column2: Freitas admitted abuse and was arrested. Accuser also filed suit. Police believe there were at least 4 more victims from about the same time frame. Pled guilty 12/02
column3: sentenced to 6 mo in jail & 5 yrs probation. Released 6/03 after US Supreme Ct ruling. 1 settlement 11/03.","Oakland, CA",CA,Source: Diocese of Oakland Apology Services 2004
column17: San Jose Mercury News 03.31.08 Assignments:San Jose Mercury News 4.2.08 (add'l article)

column1: Frey,Ross S.,1974,P,Settled,6BC169A4-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Frey, a Melkite priest, was accused of molesting numerous youths from 1973-1984 during weekend retreats at St. Basil Salvatorian Center in Methuen. Received treatment. Moved to Lebanon in 1995 to study. Placed on leave in 1996 (?) but still active priest 12/02 at Notre Dame University - Louaze. Civil Suit filed. 12 plaintiffs settled lawsuit in 1999 for $240K. Personnel files released 12/02. Omitted from 2011 Boston AD database. New accusers came forward as of 2012. Died 6/20/14.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Herald 07.04.96

Freymuth,Michael A.,1979,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave 12/04 from duties as chaplain at Cardinal Ritter High School and as part-time associate pastor at a church after allegations against him raised in lawsuit against another priest. Another man also made allegations to Archdiocese in 2002 but nothing done then. He was quietly allowed to return to parish work (in 2006?) until 1/09 when he was again removed after 3rd man notified diocese he planned to sue. This man originally complained in 2005. This suit filed 7/09.,"St. Louis, MO",MO,Source: KSDK 12.31.04
column8: St. Louis Post Dispatch 07.16.09 Assignments:SNAPmidwest.org Press Release 12.04

column1: Friese,Robert D.,1978,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Friese was teacher/counselor at Maryville Academy and abused boy on at least three occasions. At time of indictment, Friese was on leave from Chicago Archdioces and working as researcher at Univ of Illinois--Chicago's child care program. He was convicted in 1985 and placed on probation for 4 yrs and sent to House of Affirmation. Resigned from priesthood 8/85. Laicized 7/87.","Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Archdiocesan Report 3.20.06 page 2
column5: Chicago Archdiocesan Report 08.16.09 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Fritsch,Edward J.,1965,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in 2002 suit of raping a girl age 13 in 1966. Complainant demanded release of diocesan file and 12/04 settlement revealed Covington diocese hospitalized Fritsch in 1965 after he had ""contact with about 9 to 10 girls,"" one age 15. Behavior continued in treatment. Fritsch was returned to work then suspended. Sent to Owensboro diocese. Complainant alleges abuse there and Evansville IN diocese. Left priesthood
column2: married 1969. Then worked in NJ with delinquents and on school board.","Covington, KY",KY,Source: Lexington Herald Leader 08.10.02

column1: Frost,Edmund,,B,Sued,6CBAE4D5-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Worked at St. Albert the Great, Minneapolis, from 1964-1975. Left archdiocese in 1975. Sued 2005. Accused of abuse and giving plaintiff alcohol and marijuana. Case settled for $450K plus past therapy just before trial. Also named as abuser of 1 or 2 other youths from 1972-1973 in lawsuit in 2000 which was dismissed by Minn. Court of Appeals due to statute of limitations. At one time Frost was a Dominican brother. Apparently later became priest. Frost died prior to 3/05. Name appears on list released by St. Paul Archdiocese 05.22.14","St. Paul-Minneapolis, MN",MN,"Source: Doe 28B et al v Archdiocese of St Paul & Minn, Court of Appeals 06.20.00

Frost,Peter J.,1970,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Became a military chaplain in 1971 just one year after ordination. By 1974 he was placed on sick leave. Three years later he was back in parishes. Finally removed in 1992. Allegation of abuse surfaced in 1980. Admitted abusing as far back as 1969 as deacon before his ordination and to being a sex addict. Also admitted one victim committed suicide. Named in 3 civil suits beginning in 2002. ""Voluntarily"" laicized 6/05. Boston AD database in 8/11 says case concluded canonically.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 5.2.02
column12: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Fugee,Michael C.,1994,P,none,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,NOTE: RECORD UNDER REVISION AS OF 11/8/13. On 11/1/13 Fugee agreed (as part of criminal case against him for contempt of court based on recent behavior) to voluntarily seek laicization. Laicization announced 3/17/14.,"Newark, NJ",NJ,Source: Collection of Articles Prior to 05.06.13

column1: Fugolo,Joseph,1967,P,Accused,CB0624A2-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in 1997 of taking nude photographs in late 1960s of same boy who was, at other times, being abused by Fr. John Bocciarelli, pastor of same church. Denied allegations. As of 4/08 he was serving as Administrator of St. Charles Seminary/Residence in Dongan Hills, NY. Resigned as superior of the province in 2009. In Montreal in 2010. Omitted from 2011 Boston AD database. Per parish website in 10/15, is pastor of Madre die Cristiani in Lasalle, Quebec, Canada.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Docs produced by Boston Archdiocese: 1997 letter by Fugulo denying allegation
column2: Docs produced by Boston Archdiocese: 1997 memo describing allegations

column1: Funcheon,Gerald,1965,P,Settled,C6E8AD1E-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Banned from IN because he was ""planning"" to molest. 1st suit in 9/03 re abuse in 1970s at Catholic School in MN. 2nd person alleged abuse in late 1970s. Rec'd $30K for counseling. Allegations while chaplain in Air Force in HI 1982-1984 and Parma High 1984-1985. 2007 suit in IN. 3 claims in 2/09 settlement with Crosiers in MN. Left Order in 1980s. Multiple new suits in 2012-2013. Admitted abuse in Deposition. 6 claims settled in 5/13 Christian Brothers settlement. Named on revised St. Paul list 02/17/14. Also assigned to St. Cloud diocese.","St. Paul-Minneapolis, MN",MN,Source: Collection of Articles Prior to 03.01.13

column1: Funke,James A.,1974,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Assigned to Bishop DuBourg High from 1979-1986. Funke and a lay teacher at the school were arrested 10/86 and charged with sexual assault of one youth. Funke pled guilty in 1987 to 10 counts of second-degree deviate sexual assault of two boys. Police found child porn in his possession. Received 10 yrs prison
column2: released in 1992. First victim to report Funke committed suicide at age 21. Laicization announced 11/03/06. One of 6 priests included in 7/08 settlement. On MO sex offender registry as of 5/15/11.,"St. Louis, MO",MO,Source: St. Louis Post Dispatch 10.31.86
column12: Archdiocese of St. Louis Press Release 11.03.06
column16: St. Louis Post-Dispatch 11.04.06 Assignments:St. Louis Post-Dispatch 7.8.08 (add'l article)

column1: Furdek,John M.,1984,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Member of Joliet Diocese. Arrested in WI in Feb. 2000 on charges of using Internet to set up a meeting with someone who he thought was a 14 year old boy (actually an undercover agent). Privileges removed at same time. Pleaded guilty in WI in 3/03. Sentenced to 15 yrs in prison on attempted sexual assault. Served 3 yrs w/ rest probation. Paroled 5/06. In 2/07 he was being forced to move from condo because daycare was on 1st floor and school was next door. On Sex Offender Registry.,"Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Chicago Tribune 02.19.00

Ministry permanently restricted in 2004 and he was ordered to live a supervised life. Died 10/27/09 per Archdiocese website accessed 8/4/10.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report

column1: Fushek,Dale J.,1978,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Civil suit settled 2002. Accused of sexual harassment. Criminal charges filed 11/05 re abuse of five youths between 1985-1994. Another civil suit filed in 2005 alleged that he gave a youth alcohol and masturbated while the youth was molested by Mark Lehman. This suit settled in 12/06 for $100K. Excommunicated by Bishop 12/08 for offering his own non-denominational services, . Laicization announced 2/16/10. Pleaded guilty to 1 count 4/10. Sentenced to 364 days probation.","Phoenix, AZ",AZ,Source: Arizona Republic 05.31.02

column1: Fusoni,Joseph A.,1960,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Records show leave of absence 1978-1979. Accused in 1993 of having molested a 15 year old altar boy during summer of 1985. Victim claimed that the pastor, Fr. O'Sullivan had been told of the abuse and that O'Sullivan said there had been a previous allegation against Fusoni by the parents of another boy. Died 7/3/88 at age 55 of lung cancer. 8/11 Boston AD database reports no formal determination of guilt either because he died prior to canonical investigation or it was not complete at his death.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Notes on O'Sullivan Report 03.27.93

column1: Gallatin,Joseph G.,1997,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Removed from Mendota parish 12/13 after review of personnel file by outside agency found reference to incident of inappropriate conduct with minor around 1998. column2: act classified as boundary violation, not crime. Matter reported to criminal authority
column3: another review conducted. Review board determined in 6/14 ""significant restrictions"" to be placed on Gallatin with continued monitoring and limited ministry not involving children. Allegations surfaced he abused same youth on 1998 mission trip to WV. Reassigned to position with no parish responsibilities or contact with youth. Archdiocese's statement 7/02/14 that Gallatin was scheduled to attend graduate school at Catholic University in Wash., DC withdrawn 8/14 after protests. Removal from ministry announced 9/2/15 after new Ministerial Review Board found sufficient evidence of abuse. Referred to Rome for adjucation.","St. Paul-Minneapolis, MN",MN,Source: CBS Minnesota 12.29.13

column16: SNAP Press Release 10.01.13 Assignments:BA.org Summary of Directory Entries

column1: Geoghan,John J,1962,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Involuntarily laicized 1998. Accused in over 87 lawsuits of raping and molesting at least 150 children. Convicted 1/02 of fondling a 10-year-old boy. Sentenced to 9-10 yrs in prison. Murdered in prison 8/03 by another inmate. Conviction then removed by court, citing pending appeal at time of death. In 2002 Archdiocese paid $10M to settle claims brought by 86 accusers but another two dozen civil suits were still pending.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.30.01
column16: SNAP Statement 03.19.14 Assignments:Boston Globe Assignment Record 1.7.02

column1: Ghastin,Kenneth,,B,Settled,47A15D80-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In personnel file released in 12/02, there are claims that Ghastin molested two brothers at Christopher Columbus H.S. in early 1970s. Claims settled 1994. Later, the oldest brother (who received $30K) committed suicide. Ghastin was removed from contact with children in early 1990s. Last known to be working as librarian at Mount Alvernia Friary in Wappingers Falls, N.Y. May have retired to FL due to ill health. Omitted from 2011 Boston AD database. Also worked in Pittsburgh Diocese. Died 10/02/13.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Biographies for Religious Jubilarians 2009
column13: SNAP Media Statement 06.17.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Giandelone,John Maurice,1978,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Arrested in 1984 and confessed that he had molested youth for several yrs.. Civil suit filed 3/04. Pled guilty in 1985 to attempted sexual misconduct with minor
column2: sentenced to 1 yr jail on work furlough and 5 yr probation. Named in other civil suit in1993 & 2003. Convicted again in 2003 and sentenced to 1 yr 10 mo in prison & 3 yrs probation for abuse in 1979. Lives in Ft. Myers, FL as of 2/10. On national Sex Offender Registry. Reportedly voluntarily left the priesthood.","Phoenix, AZ",AZ,Source: Phoenix New Times 10.25.89

column1: Giannini,Norma,,N,Convicted,FE0430C4-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Removed from service by order in 1992 after Archdiocese reported complaints. No report to police. Sent for treatment and assigned to office work. Retired. Publicly accused in 2006 of abusing 2 male students multiple times in 1960s at St. Patrick's Elem.in Milwaukee. Transferred in 1970s to an all-girls school in the Chicago area. Indicted on 2 felony counts 12/06. Admitted other victims. Sentenced 2/08 to 1 yr jail, 9 yrs probation. Released 4/09. Civil suit filed 5/09. Died 4/18/11 in Omaha.","Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Fox28 1.9.07
column15: Milwaukee Journal Sentinel 11.13.07 Assignments:Chicago Tribune 2.2.08 (add'l article)

column1: Giesler,Linus T.,1941,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Man filed suit 6/02 alleging that he was abused at ages 7-11 by Fr. Giesler and Fr. Thomas Casper. Plaintiff told his grandmother and she sent him to live elsewhere. Giesler died in 1999.,"Louisville, KY",KY,Source: Courier Journal 9.29.02 (Major Account)
column4: Courier-Journal 09.29.02 Assignments:Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Gildea,James J,1957,P,Settled,C1E198E9-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 1991, a man reported to Bronkiewicz, vicar for clergy in the Bridgeport diocese, that Gildea abused him in 1976-1979, starting at age 13, when he was a student at Notre Dame, a diocesan high school, during trips to Wilkes-Barre PA to visit Gildea's sick mother
column2: the diocese settled on 7/31/06 with US Magistrate Garfinkel mediating. Gildea allegedly used his power as guidance counsellor to threaten the boy. Learning of that settlement, a second man went public 8/4/06 about a $60K settlement the diocese offered him in 8/02 when he informed them of abuse done by Gildea in 1958-1966, starting at age 7 or 8 and continuing into his first 2 years at Notre Dame HS. Victim's attorney in the 7/31/06 settlement stated that she knows of a third victim, perhaps the person on whose behalf her firm settled with the Hartford archdiocese in 8/08
column3: abuse by Gildea and Fr William Coleman was alleged. Gildea died 7/5/86.","Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: Connecticut Post 08.01.06

column1: Giliberti,Francis A.,1970,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse of at least 4 teenage boys between 1960s and 1976. Archdiocese learned of abuse in 2002 and 2004. His faculties were restricted. Accusations found credible in 2004. Ministry is permanently restricted and he is living a supervised life. Counting Giliberti, at least 5 members of his 1970 seminary class have been defrocked or removed from ministry over abuse allegations, including Gana, Avery, DePaoli and James M. McGuire.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column8: Philadelphia Inquirer 04.16.12 Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesian Priest Data Profile

column1: Gill,Joseph C.,1959,P,Accused,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2003 man said he was molested by Gill and abused by other Jesuit priests and brothers at St. Francis Indian School on the Rosebud Reservation in 1960s. Gill was accused of beating boys and of talking ""about Jesus Christ while his hand was down the kid's pants fondling him."" He was principal from 1961-1972 and was still at the reservation in 2003. Died 12-9-12 at age 86.","Rapid City, SD",SD,Source: Pioneer Press in Washington Post 06.02.03
column3: Jesuits - Wisconsin Province 12.09.12 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Gill,Paul,1966,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Civil suit filed Sept. 2002 alleged Gill molested a 14 yr old boy in 1977 in rectory and on trip to New Hampshire. Victim did not tell parents until 2002 and they then told the Diocese. Gill, who retired in 1998, was barred from public ministry at that time. Another man filed suit in June 2003 alleging abuse in 1975. Name appears on list of priests released by San Diego Diocese 3/07.","San Diego, CA",CA,Source: San Diego Union Tribune 09.05.02
column7: San Diego Union Tribune 03.31.07 Assignments:Diocese of San Diego List 3.30.07

column1: Gillen,A. M .D.,1926,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Ordained in Canada. In Helena diocese 1950-65. Accused of sexual abuse of at least one minor. Included on the Helena diocese's list posted to its website 4/29/15 in compliance with the non monetary terms of the 3/5/15 bankruptcy settlement. Died 7/30/87.,"Helena, MT",MT,Source: Helena Diocese Bankruptcy Settlement 03.04.15
column2: Diocese of Helena 04.29.15 Assignments:Diocese of Helena 04.29.15

column1: Gillespie,Jerome F.,1982,P,Arrested,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of asking oral sex on 1/25/05 from woman and 12-yr-old daughter. Pleaded not guilty to enticing child, soliciting sex, annoying/accosting, and assault. Most charges dismissed 4/4/05. Pleaded sufficient facts to annoying/accosting charge. Case continued pending alcohol and sexual offender evaluations with treatment if indicated, and no contact with minors without disclosing case. Case dismissed 2007. Returned to work without announcement. Lynnfield supply priest 4/08. Awaiting assignment 6/10. Still unassigned 2015, in residence at a Charlestown parish.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.28.05
column9: Fox News 04.28.08 Assignments:Detailed BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Gillespie,John E.,1953,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse of 5 youths over a period spanning from 1958 to 1997. Archdiocese knew of his behavior as early as 1994. Placed on leave in 2002. Further restrictions added in 2004. Ministry was permanently restricted. Living a supervised life when he died 2008. Named in new Grand Jury Report 2/10/11. Civil suit filed 3/11 alleged abuse of one boy, aged 14-17, from 1994-1997 at Our Lady of Calvary parish in Philadelphia. 2nd suit filed 3/21/11. On secret 1994 list.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column17: PennLive 10.06.15 Assignments:1994 Memo from Fr. William Lynn to Asst. Vicar for Admin. re Names in Philadelphia Secret Archives, released 2.27.12 (add'l article)

column1: Gillespie,Thomas,1964,P,Accused,42C6FE9C-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Suit filed against two other priests (Moorse and Tarlton) included allegation that Gillespie abused a boy at St. John's Abbey in 1977-1978. He lives under restrictions at the Abbey. Per 7/13/08 posting, four former students have accused him of abuse between 1977-1987. Name not on 12/05/13 St. Paul list but was one of 17 priests listed on 8/02 memo to ABp Flynn regarding priests with known abuse histories. Also was on list released by Abbey 12/9/13, by St Cloud 1/3/14 & St Paul's rev. list 02/17/14. St. Paul personnel file released 05/19/14.","St. Cloud, MN",MN,"Source: Star Tribune 06.07.02
column5: Behind the Pine Curtain: 50 years a Monk 07.13.08
column12: Diocese of St Cloud--Bishop Kettler Press Release, 01.03.14
column17: Archdiocese of St Paul & Minneapolis List of Priests Accused of Abuse, revised 02.17.14
column23: Media Release by Jeff Anderson & Assoc 05.18.14
column24: Gillespie Personnel File from St Paul Archdiocese Released by Jeff Anderson 05.19.14
column25: Gillespie Timeline Released by Jeff Anderson 05.19.14
column31: WCCO 05.19.14 Assignments:Assignment Record from Archdiocese of St Paul"

column1: Gillette,Randal (James R.),1971,P,Accused,6EB35977-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Personnel file released 1/03. It contained 9/02 letter accusing him of sexually assaulting a boy at St. Gabriel's Parish in Brighton in 1972. No other information found. Omitted from 2011 Boston AD database.,"Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.18.03

Gilpin,Joseph,,S,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Gilpin, a former seminarian, was sued 1/01 for repeatedly abusing a boy from 1965-1968. Case settled 2004. Personnel file was released 12/02. Gilpin was living in FL and working as assistant prinicpal in middle school but resigned when his name became public. Allegations came out that he had made inappropriate comments to students in FL. Also sued by 1 in ME when he was working there while a seminarian. Omitted from 2011 Boston AD database.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Bradenton Herald 2.2.05

Ginty,Denis,1927,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Ordained in Ireland. Came to Los Angeles 1928. Died 1985. Accusations in 1993 of abuse in 1932. 1997 allegations of abuse from 1978-1980. Civil suit filed in 2003 re abuse in 1932. Archdiocesan report says 4 accusers.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 2 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

Givey,David W.,1971,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"From 1984-1991 he was the editor of Catholic Standard & Times. Retired 2006. One of 26 priests placed on admin. leave by archdiocese after they were named as persons of concern in a 2/11 Philadelphia grand jury report. Believed to be living in Camden Diocese. Has denied allegations. Found ""unsuitable for ministry"" per 7/6/12 announcement due to violation of the Standards of Ministerial Behavior and Boundaries. There are no substantiated allegations of sexual abuse.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: National Catholic Reporter 7.6.12
column14: Catholics4Change 03.12.13 Assignments:Background on Priest from Archdiocese of Philadelphia

column1: Gluch,Robert A.,1964,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,2002 suit alleges abuse of one youth beginning at age 13 in 1965. Sued at least twice in 2003 in Arizona. Also sued in California. Died 1993. At least 2 claims included in Tucson settlement as part of bankruptcy.,"Tucson, AZ",AZ,Source: Arizona Daily Star 9.4.02
column15: Arizona Republic 01.26.06 Assignments:Arizona Daily Star 2.10.08 (add'l article)
column16: Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests n.d.

column1: Glynn,Thomas,1938,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Man filed suit 6/03 claiming he was abused by Glynn for 3 yrs in early 1970s. Later article says two other allegations have surfaced since suit was filed. 4 other men filed suit 10/03. One said he told another priest in 1971. If action had been taken, the other 3 would not have been abused. Glynn was a Navy chaplain in WWII. He died 1993 at age 80. At least 1 claim included in 10/05 settlement with Archdiocese.","Hartford, CT",CT,Source: News4Jax.com 06.18.03

Godin,James M.,1979,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Godin resigned in 2002 and acknowledged involvement in ""inappropriate behavior"" with a 17 year old boy 19 years before when he had a drinking problem. Facts became known during 5/02 review of personnel files. Was fully restricted from priestly ministry per 2004 Archdiocesan statement but had been laicized by time list was revised 11/07.","Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Archdiocese of Milwaukeee List of Clergy Offenders 3.3.12
column7: Statement by Archdiocese of Milwaukee 11.26.07 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Goeke,"John """"Jack""""",1959,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Arraigned 8/94 on charges he abused two girls in early 1960s
column2: removed by diocese. Criminal charges dropped when women did not want to pursue charges. 3rd woman filed a civil suit which claimed he took advantage of her when she sought marriage counseling. This suit settled in 1997. Permanently removed 2002 after Dallas Bishop Conference. Two women filed complaints 12/04 as part of class action alleging abuse in 1963 and 1971 when they were 11 and 15.,"Covington, KY",KY,Source: Cincinnati Enquirer 03.16.02

column1: Goltz,William A.,1950,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse of minor boys. 3 lawsuits filed 2005. Earliest alleged abuse was in 1950s. Former Archbishop Binz apparently held formal church trial, removd Goltz from active priesthood, and sent him for therapy over a 12 yr period. He was then reassigned to active priesthood for 18 yrs (abused again) and retired in 1991. In 1992, the Vatican removed his privileges and, in 2005, ordered him to live a life of prayer and penance. Died 1/06.. Claims included in 2/06 settlement. Another claim settled 3/08.","Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: Courier 3.3.05
column18: Archdiocesan Report on Assignments and Other Info 9.22.06

column1: Gomez Macouzet,Maximiliano,1946,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Native of Mexico. Ordained for San Diego in 1946. Graduate studies in Rome 1948-1951. Began working in San Bernardino diocese in 8/53. Left diocese in 1966 and was incardinated in Diocese of Tlalnepantla, Mexico 6/67. One civil suit filed 1966 alleged assault & battery of 17 yr old boy in 1962. $35K judgment 6/68. Name appears on list of priests w/ credible allegations released by San Diego Diocese 3/07. Personnel file released 10/25.10 by San Diego..","San Bernardino, CA",CA,Source: Lompoc Record 03.30.07
column3: Documents Released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10 Assignments:Diocese of San Diego List 3.30.07

column1: Gonzalez Rios,Juan Jose,,S,Arrested,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Seminary student at Mount Angel Seminary in Oregon until he was dismissed in 2003. Warrant was issued in 2005 for his arrest on felony charges of encouraging child sex abuse (child pornography). When he was arrested in 3/08, he was working at St. PeterRetreat Center in Yakima Alaska Diocese. Yakima bishop knew of earlier allegation
column2: thought it was an isolated incident and duties did not involve children. Gonzalea claims he was abused by a priest before entering seminary. Criminal charges dropped 5/09","Portland, OR",OR,Source: KIMA 4.3.08

column1: Goodman,Norman D.,1960,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"12 young men filed suits beginning 8/98 alleging that Goodman abused them (mostly in 1980s) and that at least twice Diocese officials were informed of the abuse but failed to take action. Other suits followed. Goodman ""resigned"" from parish in 1997. Settlement with 13 in 1999. Placed on perm. leave in 2002. Lawsuit filed 2005, dropped, and re-filed 1/06. This suit dismissed 6/07 as beyond SOL. Named in 4/07 lawsuit. This suit, with others, were dismissed on SOL in 2007 & 2008. All may be reinstated 1/09.","Peoria, IL",IL,Source: State Journal-Register 12.10.97

Gopaul,Paul A.,1952,P,Accused,8E3CC676-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Gopaul, a native of Trinadad, was visiting professor at St. John's Abbey in 1970 when he allegedly drugged and raped a student. Accusation made to the Abbey in 1971 by the boy's father. The boy committed suicide in 2/71. Gopaul died in 1988 while working in Los Angeles Archdiocese. Allegation made again by victim's sisters in 2006. Abbey admits a complaint in 2002. The 1971 complaint actually found in archives in 2006. As many as 10 other victims and settlement in 2002.","St. Cloud, MN",MN,Source: Pahrump Valley Times 1.1.09

Gorecki,Joseph,1959,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of molesting at least 2 youths over several years. Civil suit filed 1995. 5 plaintiffs were in the suit by 1999. Settled 3/01. Other claims settled by Diocese as part of massive $20M settlement w/ 40 people in 10/03. One man said Gorecki fondled him on several occasions. He finally told his mom
column2: she complained to nun at school. Shortly thereafter, Gorecki was ""gone."" He spent time outside diocese before being reassigned to different parishes. Died 1988. Another settlement 3/11.","Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: Associated Press 2.3.99
column18: Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Gorham,Peter Paul,1953,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused in 1995 of abuse dating back to 1953. Retired in 1996 and has had no duties since that time. Diocese announced 1/07 that Vatican had permanently removed him from ministry and ordered him to lead a life of prayer and penance. Died 9/14/09.,"Portland, ME",ME,Source: Portland Press Herald and Maine Sunday Telegram 01.28.07

Goryczka,Stanislaus,1923,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"On 1/03/14 the Diocese of St. Cloud released the names of 33 clergy, including Goryczka, involved in incidents of likely claims of sexual abuse of minors. No information on the parish where the abuse occurred or when it occurred. He worked in parishes in Harding (Pulaski), Elmsdale and Little Falls. Died 4/18/41.","St. Cloud, MN",MN,"Source: FingAGrave 04.18.41
column2: Diocese of St Cloud--Bishop Kettler Press Release, 01.03.14

column1: Govoni,Louis J.,1972,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Files released 1/03 show he was accused of abusing male student at Archbishop Williams High in 1972-1974. Believe Cardinal Medeiros was told in 1977 that teenage boys frequently stayed in his room & that one was seen partially undressed at 2:00 a.m. Absent ""without permission"" from ministry since 1978. Lawsuit filed 8/02. In 2003, he was working as substitute teacher at Duxbury High. Fired immediately. 2010 ""Voluntary"" laicization announced 2/11/11. Boston AD database in 8/11 says case concluded canonically.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.30.03
column11: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Grady,James Patrick,1977,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Arrested 7/09 after arranging to have sex with a 16 yr old girl at a secret location. Contact was actually an an undercover FBI agent in a sting. Meet arranged over the Internet. Immediately placed on leave from assignment at St. Raphael The Archangel. Later indictment said child pornography was found on his computer. Pleaded guilty 3/10 to child porn and agreeing to pay for sex w/ 16 yr old. Sentenced to 6 yr 8 mo prison and register as sex offender in 6/10.,"St. Louis, MO",MO,Source: Fox 2 8.3.09
column15: St. Louis Post-Dispatch 11.05.09 Assignments:Louisville Mojo 3.30.10 (add'l article)

column1: Grady,Richard J.,1947,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Grady, who retired in 1987 and died in 1993, is one of 10 priests named in claims of sexual molestation by victims who came forward in 2002. He is accused of molesting a boy in early 1980s. At least 1 claim against Grady settled by Diocese as part of massive settlement in Oct. 2003. Diocese paid $21M to 40 people who claim that they were abused by 16 priests, including Grady.","Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: Hartford Courant 6.5.93
column6: Connecticut Post 12.01.09 Assignments:Partial Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Graehler,Kenneth,1963,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Removed 6/02 after allegation of misconduct with a minor. In 9/02 he was scheduled to return to duty per the Bishop even though Review Board had not seen the psychological evaluation. The Diocesan Review Board found that there was ""reasonable cause"" tobelieve he took part in ""inappropriate"" conduct."" Board said that conduct did not constitute sexual misconduct with a minor but was otherwise inappropriate."" Retired 11/02.","Evansville, IN",IN,Source: BeliefNet.com 6.02
column3: Evansville Courier-Press 09.19.02 Assignments:Diocese of Evansville Website 2.3.09

column1: Graf,Harold P.,1968,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Graf suspended in June, 2002 for sexual misconduct with a child. Article says diocese learned of abuse in 1994
column2: another says 1974. On-line petition in support of Graf says the matter occurred 28 yrs ago and was handled then. 5/03 article says that Graf had been assigned to nine parishes and the Newman Center at Northern Ariz. University prior to his suspension. Permanently barred from ministry by Bishop O'Brien. No criminal or civil charges filed.","Phoenix, AZ",AZ,Source: Associated Press 06.21.02

column1: Graff,Edward R.,1955,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"""Retired"" from Allentown to Texas in 1992 but worked for Amarillo Diocese until 2002. Arrested in Texas 2002
column2: charged with abuse of 15 yr old youth. Died in jail 11/02 while awaiting trial. At least 30 men in Pennsylvania and Texas alleged abuse by him. 1 suit settled in Texas in 2003 for $275K by Allentown diocese. 1 Allentown suit filed 7/04.","Allentown, PA",PA,Source: Amarillo Globe News 9.6.03

column1: Graff,Peter M.,1941,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,One claim against Graff was included in 8/13 $5.2M out-of-court settlement involving 10 priests and 26 victims. Man alleged he had been abused in 1940s when he was a parishioner. Review board was unable to determine the credibility of the allegation. Graff died 4/8/76.,"Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: Find A Grave 04.08.76
column7: WCF Courier 08.28.13 Assignments:Archdiocese of Dubuque - Table of Accused Priests and Assignment Records 08.01.13

column1: Graham,Daniel M.,1970,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused in 1988 of repeatedly molesting a 14-year-old boy. Graham admitted that accusations were true but received positive assessment and was allowed to return to work. Another allegation in 1992 of abuse in 1980s resulted in restrictions but restrictions removed in 1996. Finally placed on leave 2/02. Still receives financial support from Diocese. Living in Quincy as of 10/08. Still on administrative leave as of 10/15 and canonical proceedings are still in process per Boston AD database.,"Boston, MA",MA,Source: Documents from Graham Personnel File
column11: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Graham,Thomas,1960,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Convicted in 2005, and sentenced to 20 years in prison for orally sodomizing a boy in the late 1970s. Archdiocese investigated in 1994 but allegations weren't substantiated. Diocese posted bond while case was being appealed. MOSupreme Court overturned the conviction & prison sentence 11/06, saying sodomy had 3 yr statute of limitations. New suit filed 3/11 by one man who alleged abuse twice in 1966. Another filed 5/12 re 1966 abuse. He is ""no longer in public ministry."" Trial in civil suit 3/13.","St. Louis, MO",MO,Source: Post Dispatch 8.31.05 (2nd article)
column15: Post Dispatch 11.08.06 Assignments:Voice from the Desert 8.18.08 (add'l article)

column1: Grammond,Maurice R.,1950,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Suit filed 12/14/99 accused sexual abuse of a boy in the late 1960s and early 1970s. Amended suit added 24 other plaintiffs
column2: settlement with 23 announced 10/9/00. Alcohol and porn used in grooming
column3: abuse allegedly included oral and anal sex. Archdiocese was warned 5 times 1959-74. Removed 1985
column6: died 2002. Another suit filed 2008 but dismissed on SOL. Appealed to Ct of Appeals. Through 2013, more than 46 claims had been settled for almost $40M. New suits filed 6/13 and 10/13 and 4/14. Note that in 2005 one accuser sentenced to 3 yrs in prison for making false allegation in a civil suit filed against Grammond. Another new suit filed 06/24/14 alleges abuse from 1969-1972 when plaintiff was age 6-9.","Portland, OR",OR,Source: Seattle Times 12.15.99

column1: Granadino,David F.,1981,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave in 2002 after being accused of abuse of 1 boy in 1980s. Denies allegation. Others have also made allegations. No claims re Granadino were included in the 12/06 settlement of cases involving 22 prieswts.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 2

Granstrand,Charles P.,1966,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,In 9/10 Granstrand announced during services at Our Lady of Mercy that Bergen Co. Prosecutor's Office had investigated allegations of sexual abuse of young children but that no criminal charges would be filed against him. Father of one man in his 20s told reporters that Granstrand had molested his son and another boy in 1996 and that his son spiraled into drugs and trouble and was currently awaiting prosecution for arson. No information from church. Still active 7/3/14.,"Newark, NJ",NJ,Source: The Record 09.13.10

Grant,Robert J.,1993 ?,P,Acquitted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave and then arrested 8/07 for allegedly sexually assaulting a 15 or 16 yr old boy in 7/07. Later released on bail. Was assigned to Saint Hedwig church as pastor at the time of the alleged abuse. Re-arrested 9/22/07 for attempting to contactthe teenager by phone. Criminal trial started 1/09. Grant denied all allegations during trial testimony. Jury found him not guilty 1/16/09.,"Hartford, CT",CT,Source: Connecticut Post 8.2.07

Graves,Alfred C.,1967,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse. 1 claim was part of 8/04 settlement re 18 priests. Also named in 12/04 suit by one plaintiff who alleged Graves raped him 1969-71, starting at age 15. Graves was inactive and living in a monitored status after diocese found allegationscredible. Had job at a retirement home but was removed 7/02. Laicization announced 12/01/06. One claim in 2008 settlement. New suit in 9/09 accused 2 former bishops of knowingly allowing abuse of 1. Suit settled 7/27/12 for $500K after trial began.","Springfield, MA",MA,"Source: Springfield Diocese List of Priests with Credible Allegations 8.30.11 (add'l article)

column1: Gustafson,Gilbert J.,1977,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Pled guilty to abusing a youth for 5 years in the 1970s. Parents found out in 1982 and complained to church officials. Gustafson sent for treatment. He also admitted abusing other boys. He paid $40 fine and served four to six months in Jail. In 11/92 woman filed suit alleging she was abused by Gustafson for about 5 years, also beginning in 1977. Suit settled 10/05. Permanently removed 2002. Vatican sentenced him to life of prayer & penance. In 7/06, Archbp. Flynn went so far as to declare him medically disabled in a binding legal agreement. Still receiving pension from Archdiocese 2/14. News in 9/15 that Gustafson trying to raise money with a survivor (not abused by him) to buy chancery for healing center (""Gilead Project"") for clergy sex abuse victims.","St. Paul-Minneapolis, MN",MN,Source: St Paul Pioneer Press 05.24.02
