column1: Rosensweig,Walter F.,1953,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 3/96, man sued Rosensweig and Diocese alleging abuse on at least two occasions in 1981. Suit settled out of court 8/97 with no amount disclosed. Rosensweig was former chancellor of diocese. He was placed on leave in 1996. He retired in 2001. In 6/02 the diocese ordered him not to perform any public ministry because of the past allegations. Named in second lawsuit filed 11/03.","Tucson, AZ",AZ,Source: Dallas Morning News 08.26.97
column8: Arizona Daily Star 07.30.07 Assignments:Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests from Website n.d.

column1: Ross,Joseph D.,1969,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Pled guilty 1988 to sexual assault of 11 yr old boy 12/86. Sentenced to 2 yrs probation and treatment. Admitted then he had been accused of molesting one youth in 1970s & had also been arrested for propositioning a police officer & public indecency. Allowed to return to work. Removed 3/02. Civil suit filed 11/02 alleged abuse of 14 yr old boy in 1977. Laicization announced 8/02. Arrested 9/08 on new charges from 2000. Crim. charges dropped 8/10. Lives in AR. New suit filed 10/11 re abuse of girl. Civil trial scheduled for 7/7/14 but case settled 07/06/14 under confidential terms. Believed to be currently living in St. Charles, MO as of 7/15/14.","St. Louis, MO",MO,Source: St Louis Post-Dispatch 03.01.02
column66: Archdiocese of St Louis Statement regarding Ross Settlement 07.07.14
column78: Archdiocese of St Paul regarding Ross 07.09.14

column1: Rossell,Joseph (Jose),1930,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Born and ordained in Spain as member of Sons of Holy Family. Arrived in CO. in 1947. Came to San Diego in 1953 and incardinated there in 1954. Frequent transfers 1st 3 yrs then spent 16 yrs at St. Anthony in National City. Name appears on list of priests with credible allegations of abuse as released by San Diego Diocese 3/30/07. No specific information found as to actual allegations. Retired to Spain in 1972 and died in 1982. Personnel file released 10/25/10.,"San Diego, CA",CA,Source: Lampoc Recort 03.30.07
column4: Documents Released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10 Assignments:Diocese of San Diego List 3.30.07

column1: Roszel,Stephen,1977,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Began abusing a 13 yr old girl in 1977 and continued until 1992. Wrote her letters, sent flowers, courted her, etc. Girl kept a diary He was 26--she was 13 when it began.1993 civil suit filed and then sealed by court. Placed on leave by diocese in 1994 pending investigation. Suit settled under undisclosed terms. Per June 6/02 article, he had been returned to ministry (in 1997) and had been serving at an Alexandria VA parish. In 2/04 he was no longer shown on diocese's list of active priests","Arlington, VA",VA,Source: Washington Post 2.6.94

Roulier,George,1954,P,Accused,DBD23903-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused in 2002 in MA of repeatedly hugging a boy and of putting his hands in the boy's pants once in 1983. Alleged victim says he was about 11 but he was 15 when Roulier first came to parish. Served there from 1983-1987. Also accused in 8/04 of sexual abuse of one youth (about age 10) at Immaculate Conception in Nashua NH in 1979. A woman also told diocese in 12/05 that he molested her in 1979-80. May also be a 3rd accuser in NH. Died 1987. Omitted from 2011 Boston AD database.,"Boston, MA",MA,Source: Docs produced by Boston Archdiocese: Letter from Priest who received initial allegation in 2002
column2: Docs produced by Boston Archdiocese: Memo about 2002 meeting with accuser
column3: Audit Records--Diocese of Manchester and NH AG 03.07.09

column1: Rourke,Charles,1958,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Rourke was suspended from ministry in 1984 for alcohol related medical reasons. Committed suicide in 1993. Diocese became aware of allegations of child abuse against him. From 1969-1973 he was on a leave of absence and assigned to Archdiocese of Santa Fe. He returned to duty with Tuscon diocese in 1973-1975 and 1981-1984. There was another leave of absence between 1975-1981. Named in 1 civil suit which settled in 2006 (?) as part of bankruptcy.,"Tucson, AZ",AZ,Source: Arizona Daily Star 3.7.06
column7: Arizona Republic 01.26.06 Assignments:Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests from Website n.d.
column8: Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests 8.5.11

column1: Rouse,Charles O.,1976,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Rouse admitted in 1995 that he had engaged in sexual misconduct with minors in 1970s. Facts came out in 1995 during Rouse's 2nd leave of absence for treatment of alcoholism
column2: the Attorney General's office was notified. His privileges were removed as well. July 1997 article referred to him as a priest on leave from Archdiocese doing graduate work at Washington University in St. Louis.,"Baltimore, MD",MD,Source: Baltimore Sun 05.25.95

column1: Rowe,Dorian G.,1964,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,2003 civil suit alleges abuse of one youth from 1967-1968. Archdiocese report says 2 accusers with incidents from 1967-1979. Died 1991,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 2 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

Roy,Christian F.,1975,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,In 1993 accused of abuse of youth from 1983-1990. On personal leave at the time but then his privileges were removed. At least two other complaints received. Woman sued him in 1994 claiming that Roy was counseling her and her husband and that he enteredinto homosexual relationship with her husband during the counseling. Later settled. Laicized 2006.,"Portland, ME",ME,Source: Bangor Daily News 11.07.94

Royer,Gerald J.,1947,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Per Philadelphia Archdiocese website list of accused priests, Royer was placed on leave of absence in 1960, then served as chaplain at St. Joseph Manor until 1964, and left active ministry in 1964. He was laicized in Feb. 1965. No specific information re the charges against him.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Archdiocese of Philadelphia Website Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesan Priest Data Profile

Rozo Rincon,Efrain,1953,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Confessed under oath in 2/06 to sexually abusing nephew and showing him porn in 1967-69 while working in LA parish and studying at Loyola Marymount. Also confessed to fondling a 14-year-old seminarian in Colombia previously. When the taped confession was broadcast on 9/28/06 in Bogota, the seminarian claimed that Rozo had raped him, and that other priests and a bishop had abused him too. Colombian church tribunal cleared Rozo on canonical SOL grounds on 7/23/07, commending his youth apostolate.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3
column4: Colombia Reports 01.24.11 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Ruba,Nicholas J.,1951,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Named in 10/10 civil suit by woman who accused him of abuse between 1968-1976 while he was assigned to St. Michael's in Sioux City. She was 14-21 at the time and worked at rectory. She companied to Diocese in 2006, he denied allegations and she apparently dropped the matter. Ruba retired in 1996. Died age 89 on 6/20/15 at a nursing home in Remsen, IA.","Sioux City, IA",IA,Source: KCAU 10.27.10

Rucker,George Neville,1946,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Record of abuse began shortly after ordination. First investigated by police in 1967. 1st civil suit filed 1994. Arrested 2002 on charges involving 12 girls. Criminal charges dropped 2003 due to Supreme Court ruling. Named as #1 on list of top 10 abusive priests in LA Archdiocese with 38-41 known accusers. Some claims settled in 12/06 massive $60 million settlement re 22 priests. Other claims settled in massive 7/07 $660 mil settlement. Personnel file released 1/13.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3

Rueger (Bp),George E.,1958,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Sued in 2002. Accused of abuse of a young man aged 13-14 in 1960s after giving him alcohol. Suit dropped 2003 by Plaintiff. Diocesan investigation found no proof of charges and Pope's representative to the US agreed with the findings.,"Worcester, MA",MA,"Source: Tarrant Ct, Tx, case
column10: BA.org list of U.S. Bishops Accused of Abuse 04.14.08 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record"

column1: Ruge,Kenneth Charles,1963,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse that occurred prior to 1985. Received treatment & reassigned.. Removed 1991. Died 5/2002. Included in 2003 settlement by Archdiocese. New suit filed 4/06 alleges abuse by Ruge and another priest. Archdiocese settled at least one claim in5/07 $6.65M settlement with 14 people alleging abuse by 12 priests. At least 1 more claim included in 8/08 $12.7M settlement re 11 priests. Another settlement 7/09. Personnel file released 01/14.,"Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Tribune 11.24.91
column14: Personnel File Released 01.21.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Ruglovsky,Robert,1961,P,Convicted,EBCC5762-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of molesting at least 7 boys. First abuse occurred in Ohio and Michigan and then he moved to Minnesota where he abused six other boys. Criminal charges were filed in Minnesota in 1987. Sentence was 15 yrs probaton and 1 yr. jail with participation in sex offender program. One civil suit filed in 1994 in California & 2 other suits filed in Minnesota in 1988. 1990 article says that he admitted to molesting numerous boys over a 20 yr period. Name first appears on Archdiocese of St. Paul list of accused priests rev 05.22.14,"Cleveland, OH",OH,Source: UPI 05.08.87
column6: Statement by Archdiocese of St Paul 05.22.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record
column7: Assignment Record by Archdiocese of St Paul

column1: Ruhl,John (Jon) E.,1964,P,Settled,56BD77EF-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse of at least 3 between 1970-1982. Diocese knew of 1 allegation in 1992. Named in archdiocesan report. Also named on list of abusers in Orange Diocese. Named in at least 1 civil suit. One $500K settlement in 2005. Personnel File released 09/09/13. Also worked in Cape Girardeau and Perryville, MO. Personnel file released 10/26/13.","Orange, CA",CA,Source: OC Register 04.15.92
column15: SNAP Statement re Personnel File 10.25.13 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

column1: Rupp,Edward F.,1960,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 1994 civil suit, a man claimed Rupp abused him several times as a teenager in late 60s-early 70s and that Rupp was alcoholic who had committed sexual improprieties with other members of parish. Rupp had received counseling for alcoholism but he resigned from assignment and was sent for evaluation and counseling after charges made. Suit dismissed by Court 1998. Vatican ordered permanent removal from active ministry as of 6/14/07. Prayer and penance.","Cleveland, OH",OH,Source: Akron Beacon Journal 4.9.02
column7: Statement by Diocese of Cleveland 06.14.07 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Ryan,Barry E.,1976,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Air Force Chaplain for many years. Left military in 1995 after investigation in 1994 for sexual misconduct with minor in Mobile, AL. Also left active priesthood. Name became known in 2003. Pleaded guilty in late 2004 to abuse of a 6 yr old boy in fall of 2003 in NY. Suffering from stomach cancer. Resided at St. Luke's, rather than jail, because of ""Health."" Attempted suicide 8/07 to avoid sentencing. Remanded to prison 10/29/07. Living at St. John Vianney Renewal Center as of 6/09","Brooklyn, NY",NY,Source: New York Post 3.6.04

Ryan,Cornelius J.,1966,P,Accused,61269C24-AF88-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Worked in Uganda and Kenya from 1967 to 1999 where he was well-known soccer coach. Returned to Provincial House in South Bend in 2001. Removed without privileges 6/10/13 from Saint Joseph Catholic Church-Hessen Cassel after recent credible allegation that he had sexually abused a boy in Africa approx. 20 yrs previously. When confronted by the Diocese, Ryan admitted the allegations were true.","Fort Wayne-South Bend, IN",IN,Source: News-Sentinel 06.19.13
column5: Statement by Holy Cross Order in Journal Gazette 06.20.13

column1: Ryan,Donald L.,1963,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Two men filed separate suits 4/03 alleging that they were abused by Ryan in the 1960s. Claims settled as part of massive 6/03 settlement. Diocesan Review board said that charges could not be substantiated and Archbishop Kelly returned Ryan to active duty 10/03. Retired in 2008.,"Louisville, KY",KY,Source: Courier-Journal 3.7.04

Ryan,Frederick J.,1964,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Ryan, former Vice Chancellor of Archdiocese, was often responsible for receiving complaints about other priests. His personnel file contained memo from late 1970s calling him ""very dangerous and deceptive."" Not placed on leave until 03/02 after lawsuit alleged sexual misconduct with a minor. A man also came forward to allege Ryan abused his deceased brother in 1970. Second suit filed by third man re abuse of two in 1970s-1980s. Also other allegations. ""Voluntary"" laicization in 2005 announced 2006.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 03.22.02
column11: Documents from New Hampshire AG's office 03.03.03
column24: Road to Recovery 06.15.14 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Ryan,John R.,1950,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Removed from ministry 1993 for allegations that he molested boys in 1980s. Previously taught at diocesan high school. Laicization requested 9/19/03 and granted 10/13/06. Diocese settled two complaints as of 11/06. Died 11/2010. Obit. says he spent 29 years as Chaplain to The National Guard.,"Des Moines, IA",IA,Source: Channel 4000 09.19.03
column10: Des Moines Register 07.01.14 Assignments:Des Moines Register 9.20.03

column1: Ryan,Joseph Francis,1936,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Native of Ireland. Placed on leave numerous times from 1945 through 1960. Excardinated to Philadelphia Archdiocese 1965, died 12/3/76. Accused in 2002 of abuse of brother and sister in 1945-1946. Named in 1 civil suit. Personnel file released 1/13.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3
column2: The Patch 2.3.13 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Ryan,Martin P.,1976,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,In 2002 woman claimed Ryan sexually abused her when she was a teenager in 1970s. She said she told the diocese about it but they didn't suspend him because he had an unblemished record and had not abused boys. She says at least two other victims. Her claim settled 10/03 as part of $21M settlement with 40 people. Ryan was only active priest named in settlement. Remained active until 5/11 when removed for sexual harassment of adult female. Then worked as admin of new parish before becoming pastor 01/14.,"Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: CT Post
column20: CT Post 03.19.14 Assignments:Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Ryan,William J.,1933,P,Accused,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Jesuit of the Oregon Province. Apparently spent much of his career at various Indian schools and reservations in Montana, Idaho and Washington. Per statement released by Diocese of Spokane 11/07, Ryan was named in accusation that was found to be credible or proven. He died 02/06/67. No further information found.","Spokane, WA",WA,"Source: Find A Grave 02.06.67
column3: Diocese of Spokane List of Admitted, Proven or Credibly Accused Perpetrators of Sexual Abuse 11.03.09
column4: Good Jesuit, Bad Jesuit 11.12.09 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record"

column1: Ryan (Bp).,Daniel,1956,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Served as chancellor and auxiliary bishop of the Joliet Diocese before going to Springfiled, IL as Bishop in 1983. Named as a co-defendant in 1999 suit by 3 men who alleged he failed to act against sexual misconduct by clergy because he was involved in homosexual relationships of his own. He resigned as Bishop of Springfield when the suit was filed. Suspended all public ministry in 2002 amid allegations he had abused a minor in 1984.","Springfield, IL",IL,Source: State Journal Register 8.3.06
column11: BA.org list of U.S. Bishops Accused of Abuse 04.14.08 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Rydzewski,Thomas A.,1998,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Rydzewski was arrested for possession of child pornograpy and internet child pornography 12/01. Sent to St. Luke's. Pleaded guilty 7/02 and was sentenced to 27 months in prison 11/02. Released 11/15/04. He was caught as part of Operation Candyman Sting. Name appeared on Baltimore Archdiocese's 9/02 list of priests accused of abuse. On MD sex offender registry as of 1/12.,"Baltimore, MD",MD,Source: Baltimore Sun 6.7.02
column9: Rocky Mountain News 03.20.04 Assignments:Archdiocese of Baltimore 9.25.02

column1: Ryer,Robert,1943,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Ryer died 4/30/67. He was one of 40 priests named in several lawsuits filed 1/03 by 70 plaintiffs who alleged sexual abuse by the priests. Article in 2010 references three claims settled re abuse by Ryer between 1958-1960. Boston AD database in 8/11 reports no formal determination of guilt because canonical or criminal investigation was not complete at his death.,"Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.30.03
column4: Jamaica Plain Gazette 09.09.11 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Rynne,Paul P.,1956,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2003, personnel file contained allegations that he engaged in inappropriate behavior with a 17 yr old in 1986
column2: received therapy and was reassigned. In 1994 he admitted allegations that he abused and/or raped a boy in 1960s were true. Two other claimants came forward. One filed suit 1/03. Rynne had whole collection of nude photos of boys. Placed on leave after 1994 allegation
column3: retired in 1996. Died in 2001. Criminal or canonical proceedings not complete at death per 8/11 Boston AD database.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Associated Press 2.6.03
column12: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Saalfeld,Charles A.,1946,P,Accused,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Worked as teacher in Tacoma and Yakima, WA as well as in Fairbanks. One pending claim against Saalfeld shown in bankruptcy reorganization documents for Fairbanks Diocese 1/25/10. Worked at parish in Galena village at one time. Known to be a teacher at Monroe Catholic High School in Fairbanks in 1958. Died 03/05/78.","Fairbanks, AK",AK,Source: Fairbanks News-Miner 09.16.58
column2: Excerpt from Bankruptcy Reorganization Documents for Fairbanks Diocese 01.25.10 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Sabadish,Joseph F.,1945,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of a young brother and sister in early 1960s. Also a suspect in the rape and murder of a young girl but never charged. He did pass a polygraph. Died 1999. Named in 2006 civil suit. Suit dismissed by lower court and dismissal upheld by3rd Circuit Court of Appeals 11/07.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column5: Magnum v. Philadelphia Archdiocese et al, 06.14.06
column6: Law.com 11.07.07 Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesan Priest Data Profile"

column1: Saccacio,Robert J.,1961,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Saccacio was placed on leave and then ""retired"" effective May 2002 with allegations against him that he abused a teenager in 1960s. His priestly faculties were removed. He was named in one of two multimillion dollar suits filed against Diocese in April, 2003. Suit alleges he abused an altar boy in 1970s. This allegation is separate from allegations that resulted in Saccacio being placed on leave in 2002.","Rockville Centre, NY",NY,Source: Newsday 05.04.02
column4: Newsday 04.15.03 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record and Other Info

column1: Salamone,Anthony,,B,Sued,64C6E9DD-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Called Br. Francis Dominic. Five civil suits filed 2002 alleging abuse 1972-73. Transferred to Chicago 1980. Left Order in 1989. It is believed all five were settled in the massive 6/03 settlement with the archdiocese.,"Louisville, KY",KY,Source: Courier-Journal 6.8.02
column6: Courier-Journal 10.24.02 Assignments:Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Salas,Jorge Hume,1994,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave 1/99 after 4 men over 18 reported that they had been sexually accosted by Salas between 1996-1998. No criminal prosecution due to SOL. Later same year Salas himself filed suit alleging that he had been sexually abused and harassed by Bishop Ziemann of Santa Rosa. Suit settled for $535K 4/00 after Bishop admitted relationship and resigned. Salas remained priest but believed to have returned home to Costa Rica. Some doubt if Salas ever completed seminary.,"Santa Rosa, CA",CA,Source: Press Democrat 8.7.99

Salazar-Jimenez,John Anthony,1984,P,Convicted,75E1936E-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Sued 1986. Convicted 1987 of molesting 2 boys in Los Angeles. 6 yr sentence-served 4. Banned for life from LA. Moved to Amarillo diocese in 1991. Two 2002 CA criminal charges dropped 2003. Charged 2003 with assault of 18 yr old in Dallas. Convicted 7/1/05. Life sentence. New trial ordered 9/11. Accepted plea bargain 2013
column2: released for time served. Laicization announced 2/05. Claims settled in CA & TX 2007-2008. CA Personnel files released 1/13. Pled guilty 12/30/13 to more charges in TX. 10 yr sentence.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Times 12.14.86
column34: U-T San Diego (AP) 12.31.13 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Salinas,Gabriel,1916,P,Accused,915948B9-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Native of Spain. First Augustinian Father to come to the U.S. Worked in Nebraska from 1917 - 1948. Accused of abuse of 1 at Cristo Rey in Los Angeles Archdiocese between 1958-1960 Died 11/18/72. Personnel File released 09/09/13.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 02.17.04
Sanchez,Juan Francisco,1957,P,Accused,4CA47A15-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 in 1992 per archdiocesan report. .,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 6
column2: City of Angels 03.19.08 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

column1: Sanchez,Manuel Ontiveros,1954,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Ordained in Spain 1954. Working in LA archdiocese 1971
column2: incardinated 1976. Sued 2003. Accused of abuse of 1 from 1978-1981 per archdiocesan report. Archdiocese, after investigation, said evidence did not support the charges. He consistently denied theallegations. Retired and returned to Spain 2000. Claim included in 7/07 massive $660 mil settlement by LA Arch.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3
column5: News Busters 07.20.07 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Sandstrom,Lawrence,,B,Sued,C1E198E9-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 5 youths between 1955-1969 per archdiocesan report. 2 filed civil suit 12/03 alleging abuse between 1967-1969. Accusations involved children at Maryvale Catholic orphanage in Rosemead. Later went on to work at La Salle High in Pasadena and other Catholic schools in Hayward and New Orleans. Accusations made in 2003 re abuse at Rancho San Antonio in Chatsworth in 1960s. 2007 settlement with two men. Left order in 1997. Personnel file to be released in 2013.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,"Source: LA Archdiocesan Report, page 7, 02.17.04

Santillan,Juan (John),1969,P,Sued,75E1936E-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Removed 2002. Accused of abuse of boy (between age of 12-17) in 1970s. Civil suit filed 1998 but dismissed. Police investigating in 2002. Archdiocesan report says two accusers between 1977-1985. Serving as priest in Bolivia since 1998.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 6
column3: USA Today 11.11.02 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Sanz,Julian,1977,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sanz, a native of Spain, came to diocese in 1980. Became diocesan priest in 1994. Placed on leave 10/02 after youth said he had been molested in Aug. Another victim came forward later to say he was molested at age 11 during confession in 1982. Arrested in 2/03 on 2 counts of sexual abuse of a child and pleaded no contest to allegations Sentenced to prison for 5 yrs in 10/03. Civil suit filed 1/04 by the same man in criminal charges. ""Removed from priesthood 2010.""","Tucson, AZ",AZ,Source: Arizona Daily Star 8.6.04
column13: Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests from Website n.d.
column14: Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests 8.5.11

column1: Sarro,John A.,1979,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Credible allegation of abuse. Name first released on list of abusive priests released by Bishop Saltarelli 11/16/06. Removed from ministry 1998. Lives in monitored religious community in Maryland. As of 11/09 Diocese was still paying his pension and health benefits and paying $4,000/mo for his assisted living expenses.. Personnel files released 2/12.","Wilmington, DE",DE,Source: The Dialog 11.16.06
column5: Diocese of Wilmington List of Accused Priests 02.16.12
column8: BA.Org Parish Assignments of Accused Delaware Priests

column1: Satchell,Martin J.,1993,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in 1993 (year of ordination) of ""credible allegations of misconduct involving a minor [boy]."" Placed on administrative leave 1993 (after 4 months on job) through 2003. Laicized at his request 9/16/04. Taught in several prestigious schools between 1993 and 2004. Named in lawuit filed 2/14/11. Name included on secret 1994 memo from Wm. Lynn to Msgr. James Molloy (released 2/27/12) re priests in secret archives who were guilty of sexual misconduct with a minor.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column9: John Doe 10 v. Archdiocese of Philadelphia et al, 02.14.11
column12: 1994 Memo from Fr. William Lynn to Asst. Vicar for Admin. re Names in Philadelphia Secret Archives, released 02.27.12 Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesan Priest Data Profile

column1: Satterthwaite,Richard,,B,Sued,9B6A0833-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 in 1961-1962 at Cantwell High School in Montebello per Archdiocesan report addendum. Named in 1 civil suit.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

Savage,Joseph E.,1918,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Newly identified as abuser in Chicago Archdiocesan Report 3/20/06. Forced to resign from an Illinois parish in 1936 for sexually abusing a 14 year old boy. Accused in 2002 and 2003 of having sexually abused numerous WI children, both boys and girls, in the 1950s. His victims were said to have been between the ages of 8 and 16. Shown as absent with leave from 1938-1960 and retired as of 1960. Died 6/74","Chicago, IL",IL,"Source: History of St Mary Church of Minooka, Illinois

Savino,Dominic,1958,P,Sued,862B0A4E-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2002 he was removed from presidency of Crespi Carmelite High School in Encino after allegations he abused 2 brothers in 1979 as well as others in 1970s. Police notified. He ""acknowledged"" some incidents and that he had sought therapy and counseling.Also accused of abusing 5 high school boys in Louisville, KY from 1966-1973. Named in civil suit. Claims by 7 individuals included in $10M settlement 10/06 with Order and LA Archdiocese.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 6
column9: Catholic Key 11.10.06 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Savoie,Johnny S,1995,P,Accused,A7A2D8CF-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Mobile archdiocesan VAC was contacted apparently in late 2013 by man alleging that Savoie had engaged in 'inappropriate sexual conduct' with him as a boy aged 16-18 in about 2005 at St Lawrence church in Fairhope. Archdiocesan lawyer contacted county DA in 12/13 and 1/14. DA did not investigate because at age 16, the accuser was beyond the AL age of consent. Archdiocese did not place Savoie on leave, and it is not known whether AL child protection officials were notified. The archdiocese reportedly investigated by 2/16/14, when Savoie announced to parishioners: he had been accused, he 'adamantly denied' the allegation, and as the archdiocese 'has determined that there is no evidence to support the accusation,' he 'will remain serving as pastor of St Pius X,' where the principal of the grammar school reports to him. In Savoie's 9/30/14 deposition in a case accusing him of ignoring bullying complaints at the school, he stated that the Fairhope boy was working part-time at St Lawrence.","Mobile, AL",AL,Source: Savoie Statement 02.16.14

Savord,William R.,1957,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Name appears on list of priests with credible allegations as released by San Diego diocese 3/30/07. No apecific information found as to actual allegations. Became part of San Bernardino Diocese in 1984. Out of active priesthood 10/88 without privileges& sent to Paracletes. Resigned 8/90 because of problems in his ""past life."" Died 7/04. Personnel file released 10/24/10.","San Diego, CA",CA,Source: Lompoc Record 03.30.07
column4: Documents released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10 Assignments:Diocese of San Diego List 3.30.07

column1: Sayasaya,Fernando,,P,Charged,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Removed 8/98 after complaint of sexual abuse. When allegations first arose, he fled to Philippines. 2002 articles say that he admitted abusing 3 youths. Criminally charged 12/02 in U.S. Efforts to extradite him to the states for prosecution were unsuccessful. Sayasaya was educated overseas, including theological schooling, but he was ordained a priest for the Fargo Diocese in 1995. Laicization announced 12/05. Philippine Court of Appeals ordered him extradited to U.S. 4/2012.","Fargo, ND",ND,Source: Associated Press 08.19.98

Scanlan,William J.,1972,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"As early as 1987 one church official noted in personnel files that ""he fools around with kids."" Accused of raping a 12-yr-old girl 1996-1997. Sent for residential treatment. Assigned to prison ministry
column2: reassigned to parish work. Moved to California in 1998 to work in a V.A. hospital in San Jose. Investigated by Feds because of statements made by Military Vicariate. Per 8/11 Boston AD database, Review Board found accusations unsubstantiated. He retired on permanent disability with no restrictions. Died 4/26/13.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: RCAB Documents
column12: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:Boston Archdiocesan Assignment Record

column1: Schaefer,Richard,1958,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Schaefer was accused of abusing one youth on many instances. Schaefer was in charge of a group of young boys who wanted to be priests. The victim alleges that Schaefer abused five other boys in the group also and that a group of parents complained and Schaefer was transferred. Schaefer was named in a lawsuit that had just been filed.,"Rockville Centre, NY",NY,Source: Newsday 4.15.03 (2nd)
column2: Newsday 04.15.03 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record and Other Info

column1: Schaefer,Thomas S.,1953,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Abused at least 21 boys. Convicted 1996 of abuse of 5. Sentenced to 16-year sentence but judge reconsidered after he had served approx 4.5 mo. and reduced sentence to time served and treatment in MO. Sent to live at St. John Vianney in St. Louis. At least 1 claim included in $1.3M settlement with Archdiocese in 12/06. Died July 22, 2009 in MO.","Washington, DC",DC,Source: BA.org collection of articles on Schaefer

Schaeflein,Charles J.,1949,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of a minor some time prior to 1990. He retired in 1989. Placed on leave in 2005 when allegation first became known. April 2006 article says Schaefle (at age 86 or 87) has agreed to a supervised life of prayer and penance. Name is included on secret 1994 memo from Wm. Lynn to Msgr. James Molloy (released 2/27/12) re priests in secret archives who were accused of sexual misconduct with a minor with no conclusive evidence.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: Philadelphia Inquirer 11.16.05
column4: 1994 Memo from Fr. William Lynn to Asst. Vicar for Admin. re Names in Philadelphia Secret Archives, released 02.27.12 Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesan Priest Data Profile

column1: Schaller,Emmett Gilroy,,P,Sued,DBD23903-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 from 1979-1980 per Archdiocesan report. May have left priesthood. Named in one civil suit accusing him of abusing one boy at St. Ferdinand's parish. Admitted during treatment that he had been in trouble due to his sexual behavior.Order released his personnel file 7/13.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 02.17.04
column2: Contra Costa Times 07.31.13 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

column1: Scherzer,Edwin J.,1950,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Retired 1995. Removed 5/02 after lawsuit filed. Two more suits filed by 1/03. Chancellor from 1966 to 1982 said he had been approached by a parent claiming Scherzer had acted inappropriately with his son but made no record of complaint. A 4th suit filed in 4/03 alleging abuse 1963-1964. Indicted 2005. Pled guilty 11/05 to abuse of 4 boys in late 1950s-early 1960s. Sentenced to 5 yrs house arrest. Claims included in 6/03 mass settlement with Archdiocese. Ordered to life of prayer & penance.,"Louisville, KY",KY,Source: Courier Journal 05.22.02
column19: Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Schetter,Albert E.,1955,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sued 2003 by two men. Accused of abuse. He admitted to past child abuse and had been warned (in 1992 or 1993) to stay away from children. Schetter had been sent on a ""spiritual retreat"" in the early 1960s to deal with his ""odd behavior"" with children. Retired 1990. Died 2002.","Cincinnati, OH",OH,"Source: Associated Press 11.05.03

Schik,Anton,,B,Accused,C6E8AD1E-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Worked at Crosier Seminary and Monastery in Onamia, MN from 1932-1948. At Wawasee Prep in Syracuse, IN from 1948 until he died 12/22/71. Name is included on 3/8/14 updated list of current, former and deceased Crosiers with one or more credible claims of sexual abuse of minors. He was deceased by the time the allegation of abuse was made. Unable to determine where he was assigned at time alleged abuse occurred. Diocese may be either Fort Wayne-South Bend, IN or St. Cloud MN.","St. Cloud, MN",MN,Source: Find A Grave 12.21.71
column2: Crosier Province Updated List of Religious Involved in Sexual Abuse of Minors 03.08.14

column1: Schipper,Carl Anthony,1968,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Arrested 3/00 after he held a series of explicit sexual conversations with what he thought was a 13 yr old boy in an Internet Chat Room. He was immediately placed on leave from position as academic dean at Menlo Park's St. Patrick's Seminary. Pled no contest 8/00. Sentenced to 6 mo. jail and 3 yrs probation and to register as sex offender. Retired in 2003.,"San Francisco, CA",CA,Source: Guardian 5.8.02
column6: Religion News Service 07.18.07 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Schlueter,Clemens M.,,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Came to Diocese of Tucson in 1961 as a priest of the Diocese of Steubenville. He became a priest of the Diocese of Tucson in 1978 and retired in 1990. It was announced in 6/02 that Schlueter had been suspended from ministry in 1997 after Diocese learnedof an allegation of child abuse related to his assignments in the 1960s. Died 9/09.,"Tucson, AZ",AZ,Source: Arizona Daily Star 06.22.02
column5: Tributes.com 08.14.11 Assignments:Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests from Website n.d.
column6: Diocese of Tucson List of Accused Priests 8.5.11

column1: Schmeer,John P.,1964,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Sued 2004. Accused of abuse of 3 boys (1966-67 and 1986). Other accusations also made. First allegations found not credible in 2003 but futher investigation in 2004 found latest allegation to be credible.Ministry permanently restricted Feb. 2005 and he is living a supervised life of prayer and pennance. Allegations against him were also discussed in 4/12 trial against Msgr. Lynn. 3 men filed 2 new suits against Schmeer 9/18/12.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column15: McDonnell v. Archdiocese of Philadelphia et al, 09.18.12 Assignments:John Doe 198 v. Archdiocese of Philadelphia 9.18.12 (add'l article)

column1: Schmelzer,Joseph M.,1977,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,In 2002 man alleged that Schmelzer abused him between 1983-1985 when he was a teenager. Says Schmelzer began touching him when he was 16 and then molested him at age 19 after giving him alcohol. The man complained first in 1993 and Schmelzer was counseled and moved. Nothing else done. Plaintiff filed a civil suit 2003. Schmelzer permanently removed after Review Board found the claims credible. Teaching Cert. revoked 11/06. 2nd allegation reported 2004 but not revealed until 2007.,"Toledo, OH",OH,Source: Toledo City Paper 8.9.04
column15: Times Bulletin 02.20.07 Assignments:Diocese of Toledo Status Report 4.8.08 (add'l article)

column1: Schmitt,Allen M.,1971,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Schmitt placed on leave 3/02 after man sent email to Archdiocese saying that Schmitt abused him in 1978 in Cedar Rapids. Schmitt admitted to the behavior when confronted by Archbishop. 2nd allegation received 4/02 concerning abuse in 1974. Works at Archdiocesan Center in Dubuque. At least 1 claim included in $2.6M settlement with Archdiocese 3/07 and another in 3/08 $4.7M settlement re 9 priests. Also at least one in 8/13 $5.2M out-of-court settlement involving 10 priests and 26 victims.,"Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: Telegraph Herald 04.30.02
column17: WCF Courier 08.28.13 Assignments:Archdiocesan Report on Assignments and Other Info 9.22.06
column18: Archdiocese of Dubuque - Table of Accused Priests and Assignment Records 08.01.13

column1: Schmitt,Urban,1949,P,Accused,B8EDBA20-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Worked in IN, NE & MN. In 1994 Fr. Schmitt admitted sexually abusing a girl in 1969. Crosier Fathers offered counseling to woman, based on psychiatric evaluation. He was sent for evaluation to St. Luke's and took early retirement in 1994 but then continued to work part-time in NE for several years. Died 07/20/99. Name is included on 3/8/14 updated list ofcurrent, former and deceased Crosiers with one or more credible claims of sexual abuse of minors.","St. Paul-Minneapolis, MN",MN,Source: Letter dated 01.05.95
column2: Crosier Province Updated List of Religious Involved in Sexual Abuse of Minors 03.08.14
column4: St Cloud Times 03.09.14 Assignments:Assignment Record Released by Crosier Order 03.08.14

column1: Schmitz,Dennis E.,1989,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave 5/02 and charged in 6/02 with improperly touching 1 teenage youth several times between 6/98-5/99. Pleaded guilty 2002 and received 32-month sentence. Also convicted in another county and sentenced 1/03 to 32 mo probation. Served as Vocations Director of Archdiocese from 1994 through 7/01. A civil suit against archdiocese was settled in 2003. Suit against Schmitz was ongoing. Schmitz agreed to seek laicization. On KS sex offender registry 1/3/10.,"Kansas City, KS",KS,Source: Associated Press 5.2.02
column15: Kansas City Star 06.21.03 Assignments:Lawrence Journal-World 6.24.10 (add'l article)

column1: Schmitz,John A.,1957,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sued 2005. Woman accused him of abuse in 1959 when she was a child. Died 1991. Parishioners had complained about his financial skills, his relationship with adult woman in 1982 and inappropriate behavior with minor girls. Sent to Paracletes. Archbishopdid not accept him back as priest. Arrived in San Bernardino Diocese 1/83. Back in Iowa by 1985 w/o privileges
column2: sued for relationship with married woman. San Diego & Dubuque personnel filed released 10/25/10.","Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: WQAD 03.14.05
column13: Documents Released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10 Assignments:Archdiocesan Report on Assignments and Other Info 9.22.06

column1: Schmitz,Josephine,1943 ?,N,Accused,D6E674FE-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abusing a boy in the early 1960s, starting at age 9. Schmitz aka Sister Mary Philip is accused of repeatedly keeping the boy after class at a Dubuque parish school, laying on top of him, and tongue-kissing him. She also worked in the Sioux City IA diocese and the Chicago IL archdiocese and is now retired. The Dubuque archdiocese found the allegation not sustained (choices were: unfounded, exonerated, not sustained, sustained) although their investigator found it credible.","Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: Des Moines Register 05.17.04

Schneider,Roger W.,1958,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Last known assignment was at St. Francis Seminary between 1966-1971. Name appears on Archdiocese's July 2004 list of priests fully restricted from ministry (or who would have been restricted if still living) because of credible allegations of abuse. 7/9/03 ist says Schneider ""left priestly ministry"" (but no date given).Per Archdiocese's 11/26/07 list, he has been laicized.","Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Archdiocese of Milwaukee List of Clergy Offenders 3.3.12
column4: Statement by Archdiocese of Milwaukee 11.26.07 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Scholl,Gerard M.,1962,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"One claim against Scholl included as part of settlement with Fort Worth Diocese 3/09 by 5 men who alleged abuse by James Reilly. Same man abused by Reilly and Scholl was also abused by James Hanlon. Scholl died in 2002.. Worked as chaplain at UT Arlington, St. Elizabeth Ann Seton parish and on Diocese Tribunal. Also spent time in Denver and Santa Fe.","Fort Worth, TX",TX,Source: BBC News 3.5.09
column3: Diocese of Fort Worth List of Accused Priests accessed 1.12
column6: DFW Catholic 03.19.09 Assignments:Fort Worth Star Telegram 1.9.02

column1: Schook,James R.,1975,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Removed 7/09 after allegation he sexually abused a male teen in 1985. Archdiocese said allegation did not involve parishs where he worked. Four more complaints received re abuse in 1970s and 1980s. Permanent removal to life of prayer & penance 2/10 after board found allegations credible. Former church worker sued 1/11 alleging termination when she turned him in. Suit dismissed 5/11. Appealed 6/11. Criminal charges filed 6/30/11 re two accusers. Ruled competent to stand trial.11/13. Trial began 4/14/14 and he was convicted of 3 counts of sodomy 4/16/14 in one case and one count of indecent or immoral practice in 2nd case. Formally sentenced 5/30/14 to 15 yrs prison and immediately arrested. He is believed to be terminally ill from skin cancer and will be housed at Kentucky State Reformatory in Oldham County which has nursing unit and hospice unit. Appeal filed 5/12/14 includes request that he be allowed to stay out of jail during appeal.,"Louisville, KY",KY,Source: Courier Journal 07.30.09
column2: Official Statement by Archdiocese of Louisville 07.30.09

column1: Schouten,Clarence J.,1929,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Last known assignment was at St. Joseph Parish (Milwaukee / Wauwatosa)between 1955-1969. Name appears on Archdiocese's July 2004 list of priests fully restricted from ministry (or who would have been restricted if still living) because of credible allegations of abuse. He died in 1978. He was accused of molesting 3 sisters in 1950s while assigned to St. Joseph Parish. One of the women settled for $125K in 2004.,"Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Archdiocese of Milwaukee List of Clergy Offenders 3.3.12
column4: Milwaukee Journal Sentinel 07.10.04 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Schrenger,Arthur C.,1975,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse and placed on leave 2003. Per 12/05 article, he has appealed to Rome the archdiocese's finding that he had two instances of misconduct with minors prior to 1985. One 2003 article says he admitted abuse. No criminal prosecution because of statute of limitations.","Mobile, AL",AL,Source: Associated Press 4.2.03

Schroeder,Othmar H.,1938,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Allegations of abuse by Schroeder between 1947-75 at Holy Family church were made public 8/18/07. Bishop Gettelfinger stated that he knew of allegations in 1996 but recently learned that ""scope is greater than we knew."" By 8/31/07 claims of abuse of at least 10 boys and girls had been received. Schroeder died 2/16/88. He began as a priest of the then-diocese of Indianapolis. His 1st parish was in Lawrence IN, near Cincinnati, now in the archdiocese of Indianapolis.","Evansville, IN",IN,Source: Bishop Gettelfinger Statement 08.18.07
column17: Indianapolis Star 04.20.14 Assignments:Detailed BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Schuhmacher,George J.,1957 ?,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Permanently removed 1/03 because of 1983 allegation that he provided alcohol to a 13 yr old boy and then sexually molested him during a campout. Boy was a resident at Campbell Lodge Boys Home (for troubled boys) run by Schuhmacher. He reported abuse to police in 1983 and Schuhmacher was removed. By 1986 he was back at the home and in 1996 he was given a parish assignment.,"Covington, KY",KY,Source: Cincinnati Enquirer 10.09.03

Schulte,Daniel R.,1987,P,Charged,56BD77EF-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Charged 2006 with downloading child pornography from Internet. Removed from position as Hospital chaplain in 2005 and sent for treatment in St. Louis. Pleaded guilty 6/06. Sentenced to 7 yrs 3 mo. prison 10/06 and must register as sex offender when released (approx 2/13). Still a priest but may face laicization later depending on what church law experts say.,"Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Sun-Times 03.22.06

Schulte,Raymond Francisco,1979,P,Sued,42C6FE9C-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Per Abbey Abuse Disclosure Project, one victim made a 9/02 statement in which he says Schulte sexually molested him 10/88. Also accused of knowing about abuse by Dunstan Moorse and John Kelly. Supposedly living a restricted lifestyle at St. John's buthas traveled frequently, including to Italy. Named in new suit 5/18/10 by two brothers claiming abuse in 1984-1986. Suit settled 3/11 with other claims against Abbey. New suit in Puerto Rico 4/11. Name on Abbey list 12/9/13 & St. Cloud list 1/3/14.","St. Cloud, MN",MN,"Source: St John's Abuse Disclosure Project (ADP)
column18: Diocese of St Cloud--Bishop Kettler Press Release, 01.03.14

column1: Schwartz,John,1981,P,Sued,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sued 2005. Accused of abuse of student in 1986-1987 in Oregon. Article says he is no longer a Jesuit but works as priest for Archdiocese of San Francisco and has taken a voluntary leave . Suit settled for $95,000 in Nov. 2005. Per 11/06 article, Schwartz is being returned to active duty because Archdiocese says accusations were not credible. Per Official Catholic Directory, he was chaplain at St. Anne's Home in San Francisco (a Home for the Aged of the Little Sisters of the Poor) from 2007 - 2011. He is not indexed past 2011..","Portland, OR",OR,"Source: Oregonian 10.07.05
column11: Good Jesuit, Bad Jesuit 11.12.09 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record"

column1: Schwartz,William T.,1958,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of youths in 1960s and 1970s. Laicized 11/05. 1 lawsuit filed 2004 settled in 2005 for $100K. 3 plaintiffs settled 2/06 as part of settlement re several priests. Settled with Schwartz in 4/06. At least 1 more claim included in $2.6M settlement with Archdiocese 3/07. 3 cases were included in 01/08 settlement with Diocese but are still pending against Schwartz individually. At least one more included in 8/13 $5.2M out-of-court settlement involving 10 priests and 26 victims.,"Dubuque, IA",IA,Source: Courier 01.16.05

column1: Scott,George M.,1925,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abusing both a boy and a girl (each about 7 or 8) between 1947-1958. Named by 2 plaintiffs in civil suit filed 12/03. Died 1986. Claims included in massive $660 mil settlement by LA archdiocese of over 500 claims July 14, 2007.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,"Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3
column4: City of Angels 12.07.07 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Scully,Richard,1978,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"1994 civil suit alleges Scully (who later moved to Hereford, Tx) abused a 15 yr old in 1980 at church school. Suit also claims Fr. Dale Calhoun abused the youth. Removed from parish in Yakima diocese in 1988 and sent to treatment. Worked in Amarillo TXfrom 1989-3/02 when he resigned. At least 2 claims settled confidentially. Seattle priest came forward 2004 to say Scully had also abused him in 1970s when he was 15. He reported it to church in 2003. Scully is no longer an active priest.","Yakima, WA",WA,"Source: Dallas Morning News 7.4.02
column5: CJC v. Bishop of Yakima et al, 94-2-01931-5, Snohomish Co., 07.25.94

column1: Seidel,Michael L.,1987,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Suspended by the Archdiocese in 1998 after an allegation of abuse of a minor was determined to be credible. Laicization announced 11/03/06.,"St. Louis, MO",MO,Source: Archdiocese of St. Louis Press Release 11.03.06

Seminatore,Joseph J.,1969,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave 2002 from Parmadale Family Services home when man came forward to allege sexual abuse at the home (which offered treatment to children with emotional problems.) Seminatore denied charges even after two more victims came forward. Allthree men filed suit 07/02. In 8/02 Seminatore filed a countersuit alleging conspiracy. Plaintiffs' case dismissed on SOL
column2: dismissal upheld by Appeals Ct. in 2006. Seminatore's claim dismissed by trial court
column3: upheld by Appeals Court 12/04.,"Cleveland, OH",OH,"Source: Ohio Court of Appeals Decision in Doe v. Moe, 2006-Ohio-5233
column9: OHIO COURT OF APPEALS, EIGHTH DISTRICT, COUNTY OF CUYAHOGA, Cause No. 84032, rendered 12.02.04 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record"

column1: Sewar,Dennis R.,1983,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sewar took a sabatical in 01/05 but was placed on leave 6/05 and then arrested 7/05. Charged with abuse of 14 yr old boy from 1999-2001. Trial set for 8/06. Allowed to plead guilty to lesser charge of attempted endangering the welfare of a child, a misdemeanor. Sentenced to 1 yr probation. In 9/08 he was teaching in Hong Kong school until a parent googled him and found his record on this website. Involuntarily dismissed from clerical state per 6/7/12 statement from Diocese.","Rochester, NY",NY,Source: Democrat and Chronicle 8.2.05

Shafer,Drake R.,1973,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Sued 2003, when he was vicar general. Accused of sexually abusing a male minor in 1973 or 1974. Denied the charge, but wrote email to the victim in 2002 that was an ""admission of serious misconduct."" Suit settled 4/05. Claims against Diocese were settled fall, 2004 as part of large settlement. He asked to be reinstated as VG. Name NOT on Diocese's 7/08 list of credibly accused priests. Review board (and secret Vatican court??) found him NOT guilty of abuse 11/08. He was reinstate.","Davenport, IA",IA,Source: Des Moines Register 07.18.03
column7: Diocese of Davenport Creditors Committee Website 08.27.07

column1: Shanley,Paul R.,1960,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Involuntarily laicized 2004. Convicted 2005 of sexually abusing boy in the 1980s. Dozens of complaints
column2: many settlements. Abuse included oral and anal rape. First complaint 1961 from parents of 12-year-old boy. Earliest complaint in file 1967 from priest alleging Shanley abused a 16-year-old boy. Shanley denied and was assigned to parish work, special ministries, and parish work again until 1989. Then was transferred to NY and San Bernardino CA, where he allegedly abused 17-year-old boy. Sentenced in 2005 to 12-15 yrs.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Affidavits
column20: Documents Released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10

column1: Sharkey,Joe,,B,Sued,72BCFADB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 from 1967-1968 per archdiocesan report. Named in civil suit.. Also on the Orange Diocese list of abusers.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 7

Sharpe,Joseph F.,1943,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Sued 2003. Accused in 1971 of abuse of 1 between 1958-1964 per archdiocesan report. Complainant was a junior and Sharpe was his confessor. Excardinated from LA and incardinated in Orange 1976. Also on that Diocese's list of abusive priests. Died 11/2/99. LA's personnel file released 1/13.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 3

Included in a list of accused priests and religious posted by the Law Offices of Mitchell Garabedian on 01/19/11. Garabedian says he has settled at least one claim with Boston Archdiocese re allegations against this individual. Retired in 1977 and died 12/89. Criminal or canonical proceedings not complete when he died per 8/11 Boston AD database.,"Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 12.14.89

column1: Shea,Francis S.,1932,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Included in a list of accused priests and religious posted by the Law Offices of Mitchell Garabedian on 01/19/11. Garabedian says he has settled at least one claim with Boston Archdiocese re allegations against this individual. Died 10/72. Worked at St. John's Seminary from 1934-50. Spent much of his later career as judge on various diocesan tribunals. Criminal or canonical proceedings not complete when he died per 8/11 Boston AD database.,"Boston, MA",MA,Source: BishopAccountability List of Boston Priests Not Previously Identified 01.19.11

column1: Shea,Thomas F.,1964,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 6 boys in 1970s. He admitted molesting two altar boys from 1972 to 1977. Placed on leave 1994 and retired with restrictions 1995. Further restrictions added 2004 and Shea agreed to permanent restriction of ministry and to live a supervised life. Documents regarding his history were introduced in trial of Msgr. Lynn in Philadelphia 4/12. He admitted paying hush money to at least 1 other victim.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column8: Philadelphia Priest Abuse Trial Blog 04.10.12 Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesan Priest Data Profile

column1: Shea,Thomas W.,1946,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused in 2004 of molesting at least 16 girls in 11 parishes where he served in the Diocese. Abuse occurred over 30 years and was often referred to in church records as ""prolonged kissing"" and not as sexual abuse. Parents would complain and Shea wouldbe transferred. Placed on leave 1983. Vatican refused to laicize in 2005. Died in 2006. One woman's civil suit settled 12/08. Another woman's 11/08 suit settled for $1.1M in 9/12 just before trial began.","Norwich, CT",CT,Source: Hartford Courant 8.4.12

Shea,William B.,1946,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Included in a list of accused priests and religious posted by the Law Offices of Mitchell Garabedian on 01/19/11. Garabedian says he has settled at least one claim with Boston Archdiocese re allegations against this priest. ""Awaiting Assignment"" from 1985-1996. Retired 1996. Died 2/05. Criminal or canonical proceedings not complete when he died per 8/11 Boston AD database.","Boston, MA",MA,"Source: Saint Charles Borromeo Parish Bulletin, Waltham, MA 1.30.11, p. 3

column1: Sheahan,John A.,1960,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 4 from 1961-1965 per archdiocesan report. Civil suit filed 12/03 includes allegations that he abused 3 during the relevant time frame. Note that name is spelled Sheehan in the civil suit. Brain surgery in early 1970s and then medical retirement.,"Orange, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocosan Report 2.17.04 page 3

Included in a list of accused priests and religious posted by the Law Offices of Mitchell Garabedian on 01/19/11. column1: Shelander,Donald E.,1970,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2006, Archdiocese removed privileges of Shelander (who retired in 2002) after man came forward to allege he had been abused between ages of 14 and 18 years old in late 1970s-early 1980s. Shelander was pastor at St. Mary Parish in Urbana at the time.Archdiocese said it found ""the semblance of truth"" in the allegations. He was returned to active status 2/09 after church tribunal (affirmed by Vatican) found him not guilty.","Cincinnati, OH",OH,Source: Cincinnati Enquirer 2.2.09
column7: Dayton Daily News 04.22.07 Assignments:The Beacon Journal 3.15.06

column1: Sheridan,Gregory Sierra,1935,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Originally from Spain. Ordained as Augustinian Father. Worked in KS, TX, NE & CA.. Arrived in San Diego 10/48
column2: incardinated there in 1952. Retired 1983 with letter of recommendation to Spanish diocese. Name appears on list of priests with credible allegations released by San Diego Diocese 3/30/07. Woman reported 1/06 that Sheridan has abused her at age 8 in 1969. May have been 2nd accuser. Died 2/91 in Spain. Personnel file released 10/24/10.","San Diego, CA",CA,Source: Lompoc Record 03.30.07
column5: Documents Released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10 Assignments:Diocese of San Diego List 3.30.07

column1: Sherlock,J. Alex,1966,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Placed on leave 2/03. First complaint received by Arch. Lipscomb in 1997 regarding abuse in 1970s. Sherlock admitted the incident
column2: Lipscomb transferred him to another parish. At least 3 further credible allegations received between 2000 and 3/03. Sherlock admitted relations with at least 3 students at McGill-Toolen High school. Resigned 2003. Died 2005.,"Mobile, AL",AL,Source: Mobile Register 5.1.03
column8: Statement by Archbishop Lipscomb in Mobile Register 03.19.03

column1: Sherry,Edward F.,1968,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Suit filed 1/03 by a man alleging he was fondled and raped by Sherry from ages 13-16, beginning about 1968. Sherry was allowed to remain as active priest until 8/03 when new Archbishop O'Malley placed him on leave. Claim settled in 2003. Sherry was allowed to return to active status at old parish 6/05 after review board was unable to substantiate the claims. Died 3/8/11. See 8/11 Boston AD database.","Boston, MA",MA,Source: Boston Globe 01.24.03
column9: National Catholic Register 08.25.11 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Sherwood,Wilputte Alanson 'Lan',1975,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Arrested 1984 and 1986 for public indecency. Arrested and convicted 1993 of sexual contact and attempted sexual contact with a 14 yr old boy in 1987 at St. Benedict Church in Chandler. Sentenced to 10 yrs in prison. Wrote in diary of over 1800 male partners,of whom 22 were minors. Released from jail 11/03 and placed at Arizona State Hospital for evaluation as sex offender. On lifetime probation. Disappeared 2005 until 11/08 arrest. On AZ sex offender registry 2/4/12.","Phoenix, AZ",AZ,Source: Arizona Republic 4.1.93

Shimmaly,Edward E.,1961,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 1 between 1961-1963 per archdiocesan report addendum. Named in at least 1 civil suit. Deceased. Name is spelled Shimmaly in Directory but Schimmaly in archdiocesan Addendum.,"Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05 Assignments:LA Times Database 4.20.06

Shiner,Kenneth H.,1945,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Man filed a civil suit in 2001 alleging that Shiner abused him for 4 years from 1980-1984 beginning when he was 14. Said Shiner would take him out for dinner and drinks before molesting him at the Rectory. Shiner denies that the abuse ever happened. No other victims have come forward. He was apparently removed 3/02. Claims included in 10/05 $22 mil settlement with Archdiocese re 14 priests.,"Hartford, CT",CT,Source: Hartford Courant 02.19.02
column6: NY Times 11.01.05 Assignments:Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Shirilla,Gerald,1968,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of at least 7 youths from 1972-1981. Named in several civil suits. Moved to Gaylord Diocese and then placed on leave in 2002. Died 2004.,"Detroit, MI",MI,Source: Archdiocese of Detroit Status Report 10.09
column15: Detroit Free Press 06.19.04 Assignments:Detroit Free Press 11.15.10 (add'l article)

column1: Shoback,Edward J.,1967,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Relieved of ministerial duties in 2004 after admitting sexual misconduct with a minor more than 20 years previously. In 2006 another man and his family came forward to allege that Shoback has also abused him at age 13. This individual received funds deducted from Shoback's pension every month for 4 years as reimb. for lost wages. No criminal charges due to SOL. Laicization announced 7/17/09. His brother, Thomas, was accused of abuse 11/11 and arrested 6/12.","Scranton, PA",PA,Source: Wilkes-Barre Times Leader 07.27.04
column4: Statement by the Diocese of Scranton 07.17.09

column1: Shoback,Thomas P.,1977,P,none,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Diocese notified 11/11 of allegations involving sexual misconduct with a minor boy between 1991-1997. Shoback was pastor of St. Mary and St. Andrew churches in Blossburg, Tioga County, at the time. Removed 2011. Arrested 6/14/12 and charged with 30 felo","Scranton, PA",PA,Source: Pocono Record 11.15.11

Sicoli,David C.,1975,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of at least 12 boys in their mid-teens during his career as a priest. Placed on administrative leave in 2004 and then further restrictions added in Feb. 2005. His case was referred to the Vatican for review and laicization announced 2/08. Named in new Grand Jury report 2/10/11. Name is included on secret 1994 memo from Wm. Lynn to Msgr. James Molloy (released 2/27/12) re priests in secret archives who were accused of sexual misconduct with a minor w no conclusive evidence.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: 1.12.78 memo from Chancellor Statkus
column15: Philadelphia Daily News 04.03.08 Assignments:Philadelphia Grand Jury Final Presentment 2.10.11, pp. 34-35
column18: 1994 Memo from Fr. William Lynn to Asst. Vicar for Admin. re Names in Philadelphia Secret Archives, released 2.27.12

column1: Siegele,Charles J.,1953,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Accused of abuse of 6-7 boys in 1950s and 1960s. 1 claim settled in 1990s and he was named in civil suit filed 2004. Named in 2006 class action suit. This suit dismissed by lower court then by Third Circuit Court of Appeals 11/07. Died 1/28/89. Name (as Siegle) is included on secret 1994 memo from Wm. Lynn to Msgr. James Molloy (released 2/27/12) re priests in secret archives who were guilty of sexual misconduct with a minor.,"Philadelphia, PA",PA,"Source: Philadelphia Grand Jury Report
column4: Mangum et al v. Archdiocese of Philadelphia et al, 06.14.06
column6: 1994 Memo from Fr. William Lynn to Asst. Vicar for Admin. re Names in Philadelphia Secret Archives, released 02.27.12 Assignments:Philadelphia Archdiocesan Priest Data Profile

column1: Sierra,Frank,1946,P,Settled,45A0846E-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Although ordained in 1946, by 1951 he was teaching in High School in Buenos Aires. Came to Pueblo CO. Diocese in 1951 to replace his brother, John Sierra. Served in El Paso and several parishes now part of Las Cruces NM diocese. in 1950s & 1960s. By 1970 he was part of San Diego CA Diocese. Named in 1994 civil suit (later settled) re abuse of girls in Santa Cruz NM., Included in San Diego list of credible abusers 3/07. Status was ""removed"". Personnel file released 10/25/10.","Las Cruces, NM",NM,Source: Albuquerque Jounral 06.14.46
column10: Docuents Released by San Diego Diocese 10.25.10 Assignments:Diocese of San Diego Assignment List 3.30.07

column1: Silva,James M.,1967,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,2 men filed suit 1994. Total of 9 men filed civil suits alleging abuse by Silva from 1960s-1980s. Criminal charges also filed in 1994. He admitted in court that he sexually abused 1 young man. Received 7 yr suspended sentence and ordered to undergo counseling. 8 claims settled by Diocese as part of $13.5M mass settlement 9/02 (believe 1 had settled earlier). Multiple transfers after initial notice.,"Providence, RI",RI,Source: Providence Journal-Bulletin 7.3.94

Silva-Flores,Fidencio Simon,1978,P,Sued,C7F7AC1F-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Native of Mexico. Left Archdiocese w/o privileges 5/1/95. Sued by many in 2002. Accused of abuse of as many as 28 boys from 1979-1985. Criminal charges dropped due to Supreme Court ruling. Believed to be in Mexico. LA archdiocese refers to him as Fidencio Flores Silva. As part of 2007 $660M settlement with 508 plaintiffs, Archdiocese was to release personnel files. Personnel file released 1/31/13.","Los Angeles, CA",CA,Source: LA Archdiocesan Report 2.17.04 page 6
column15: Ventura County Star 01.23.13 Assignments:LA Archdiocesan Report Addendum 11.15.05

column1: Silvestri,Vincent A.,1964,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Name on Archdiocese's July 2004 list of priests fully restricted from ministry (or who would have been restricted if still living) because of credible allegations of abuse. Last assignment was at St. Dominic Parish (Brookfield) between 1983-1993. Suffered stroke 2/93 and retired 10/30/93. Under restrictions as of 5/95. Died in 2000 at age 63. Personnel file released 7/13. Allegations in late 1960s-early 1970s. Settlement with at least one.,"Milwaukee, WI",WI,Source: Milwaukee Journal Sentienl 07.20.00
column4: Archdiocese of Milwaukee List of Clergy Offenders 03.03.12

column1: Simms,William Q.,1962,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Removed from parish work in 1985. Two separate civil suits filed in 1988 accused Simms of forcing boys to dress in skimpy, sexually provocative briefs and act out religious fantasies and wrestle with him. In 1985, police investigated but agreed not to press charges if Simms received counseling and was removed from contact with minors. Both cases settled in 1989 or 1990. Cardinal asked Simms to resign/retire from his administrative job with Diocese in May, 2002. Died Sept. 2005.","Baltimore, MD",MD,Source: United Press International 03.22.88
Sita (Howard),Carmen (Gerald),1976,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Arrested 1982
column2: pled guilty 1983 to abuse of a minor and providing him with drugs. 5 yrs probation & treatment at Paracletes in NM. Legally changed name to Gerald Howard. Incardinated in Jefferson City MO
column3: assigned to parish with school. Reportedly has had no clerical assignments since he was removed from active service in 1984 Accused 2007 of abusing another boy. Claim settled 2009 for $600K & agreement to laicize. Other victims in NJ and MO. Arrested 4/10 in NJ & later in MO. Remained in jail until his MO criminal trial. 5 claims settled 2013 for $650K. At 6/17/14 hearing, he pled guilty to two counts of forcible sodomy and one count of attempted forcible sodomy against three teen boys. Other counts dropped Will have to serve 3 concurrent 12 yr sentences and will have to register as sex offender when he is released from prison. Laicization on 9/24/12 was officially announced 6/18/14.","Newark, NJ",NJ,Source: Laicization Decree 09.24.12

column1: Skelton, Jr.,Joseph,2001,S,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2008 civil suit, a man alleged he was abused at age 14 by Skelton, a seminary student, and by Fr. Stallings. in the summer of 1984. The youth was helping Stallings remodel rectory at St. Teresa of Avila & staying in the rectory's attic to avoidlong commute. Case settled 10/09 for $125K. In 1988, he resigned from seminary in MI after pleading guilty to abusing a 15 yr old boy in seminary room. Ordained for Tagbilaran Diocese in Philippines and still working there as of 10/09.","Washington, DC",DC,"Source: Archdiocese of Detroit Status Report 10.09

Skiffington,Wilton,1936,P,Sued,4FA33B28-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Sued 2003. Accused of abuse of one at Loyola Academy in Wilmette in 1962. Parents found letter from priest to boy in 1968 and told archdiocese. He was transferred to Los Angeles/San Diego in 1965. Died 9/88. Civil suit settled 10/05,"Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Tribune 09.29.88

Skotek,Thomas D.,1963,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Relieved of ministerial duties 4/02 after diocese announced he had admitted to ""some improper conduct"" that occurred more than 30 years ago. Then-Bishop Timlin said Skotek had come under scrutiny several years before when a different misconduct complaint was made. But he was returned to duty after an evaluation. The ages of those involved in the two cases have never been revealed.","Scranton, PA",PA,Source: Wilkes Barre Times Leader 04.18.02
column4: Wilkes Barre Times Leader 06.28.02 Assignments:Times Leader 7.9.06

column1: Skriba,Raymond Francis,1957,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Accused of abuse of at least 2 girls while assigned to St. Gertrude Parish in Franklin Park in 1960s. Took admin. leave 6/02 and finally removed from public ministry 1/03 (7/02?) several months after review board found reasonable cause to believe the allegations were true. At least one claim included in 10/03 $8M settlement with 15 adults alleging abuse by 11 priests. Permanently removed from public ministry 9/05. Brother of Richard, also an accused abuser. Personnel files released 1/14.","Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Tribune 07.17.02
column18: Desplaines Valley News 02.05.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Skriba,Richard L.,1949,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Woman came forward 7/02 to say that Richard Skriba molested her for several years when she was young. Woman says she reported the abuse to archdiocese in 1998 but accusations were not made public because Skriba had died 3/98. Brother of Raymond, another accused abuser.","Chicago, IL",IL,Source: Chicago Tribune 03.15.98
column3: Desplaines Valley News 02.05.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Skube,Francis,,B,Accused,FD02ED63-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Name appears on the Davenport Diocese Creditors Committee Website as having credible allegations of abuse against him. Two men say they were 17-18 yr old students in Skube's small order when he abused one and beat the other. Both personally told BishopO'Keefe in 1977 but nothing done.,"Davenport, IA",IA,"Source: Blog on Franciscan Brothers of Christ the King - Davenport, Iowa 04.23.03

Skylstad (Bp),William,1960,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Proof of Claims was filed 2006 as part of Spokane Diocese's bankruptcy. Accused of abuse of teen girl at St. Patrick's Parish and at Gonzaga University from December 1961 to December 1964. He denied the allegations and later said an investigation found no evidence that the allegations were true. Retired June 2010.,"Spokane, WA",WA,Source: USA Today 03.08.06
column4: BA.org list of U.S. Bishops Accused of Abuse 04.14.08
column5: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops 06.30.10

column1: Slavish,Richard,1959,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Slavish and six other priests were placed on leave by Bishop in May 2002 after allegations of abuse involving minors. Privileges were revoked. Slavish was scheduled to retire in summer of 2002 but other article said he retired in April. Slavish apparently held parish assignments during his entire career except from 1969-1971 when he was chaplain at east Moline State Hospital. No information found on dates of abuse or victims.,"Peoria, IL",IL,Source: Catholic Post 6.9.02

Slocum,Samuel B.,1980,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,Relieved of duties 4/11 in McKean Co. when Diocese learned of inappropriate relationship with a 15-yr-old boy in 2011. Slocum would give the boy and others gifts and take pictures of them. Frequently communicated with them even after being forbidden by parents. He admitted to police that relationship with boys was inappropriate. Arraigned on 6 charges
column2: released on bail. Found guilty 1/12 on 1 charge of improper relationship. 2 yrs probation. Won't return to active ministry. Conviction being appealed.,"Erie, PA",PA,Source: Erie Times-News 04.05.11
column17: Beaumont Enterprise 02.24.14 Assignments:Centre Daily Times 5.4.12 (add'l article)

column1: Smart,Wilson F.,1957,P,Settled,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Diocese knew of attraction to boys by 1959. Received treatment in 1959 and 1969. Smart admitted molesting more than 30 boys from 1957-1978. 1990 civil suit alleged Smart abused Plaintiff in 1967 when he was 12 and that abuse continued until 1975. Settled in 1993, possibly for $1.7M. Named in at least 3 other suits which later settled. In 1993 Bishop admitted removing 2 letters from file which documented abuse. Named as abuser in amended suit 10/11. He is deceased.","Helena, MT",MT,Source: Seattle Times 04.01.93
column8: Press Release by Kosnoff Fasy 01.31.14 Assignments:BA.org Assignment Record

column1: Smit,Gerard C.,1950,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Came from Lake Charles Diocese. to Wilmington in 1987. Bishop removed him in 1996. Name first released on list of abusive priests released by Wilmington Bishop 11/16/06. Last known address was in Bear, DE. Has been working at Univ of Delaware's Academyof Lifelong Learning teaching adults over 50. Personnel files released 2/12. Absed at least 8 in Lake Charles. No. of victims in DE unknown.","Lake Charles, LA",LA,Source: The Dialog 11.16.06
column4: Diocese of Wilmington List of Accused Priests 02.16.12

column1: Smith,Alphonsus M.,1956,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,In 1995 Smith admitted affair with 1 youth from 1988-1993. Civil suit filed 1995 dismissed on statute of limitations. Sentenced 1995 to 16 years for abuse of 5. Judge reduced sebtence to <1 year in 1996. Sent to live at St. John Vianney in St. Louis. Died in 2005. At least 1 claim included in $1.3M settlment with Archdiocese 12/06.,"Washington, DC",DC,Source: 1997 MD App. LEXIS 39.
column2: see also BA.Org compilation of Schaefer articles

column1: Smith,David G.,1973,P,Convicted,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,In July 2002 Smith was charged with perverted practice after a man claimed that Smith abused him at parish rectory when he was 16 (between 1973-1976). In Oct. 2002 Smith pleaded guilty to engaging in sex acts with the Plaintiff. Smith had taken an unrelated leave of absence in 2000 and had no faculties to perform ministry.,"Baltimore, MD",MD,Source: Baltimore Sun 07.19.02

Smith,Edward J.,1973,P,Sued,60CF22C9-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"In 2002, man reported abuse by Smith at high school in Philadelphia in early 1980s. Says he also saw Smith sexually abuse 2 other boys in the presence of another priest. 4 add'l complaints from students (all later resolved?) were filed against Smith. Also abused in Delaware. Named in 2005 civil Delaware suit. Much of suit dismissed by court 11/06. Default granted against priest 1/07. $41 mil jury verdict awarded 3/30/07. Settled with Diocese 1/08. Settled 9/08 w/ Order & school.","Philadelphia, PA",PA,Source: News Journal 11.20.05 (Major Account)

Smith,Gregory M.,1967,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Placed on leave in 2002. He was accused of becoming sexually involved with two teenage girls in late 1960s-early 1970s. One girl told then Bishop Genuario in 1969 when she was abused. The other filed repeated complaints with church officials over many years but nothing done. She filed suit in 1997
column2: dismissed on SOL. Bishop Lori explained that he kept Smith working because allegations involved 'people who were very near attaining the age of majority...""","Bridgeport, CT",CT,Source: Connecticut Post 4.6.03
column18: Assignment Record Compiled by Law Firm

column1: Smith,James T.,1956,P,Sued,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Prior to 2002, he worked part time as counselor for Queens' D.A.'s office. Placed on leave from parish 4/02 because of allegations of ""inappropriate sexual contact"" with at least 26 boys & girls more than 20 years previously. Sued in 10/02 suit involving 12 priests and a brother and also in 10/03 in suit involving 24 priests. Sued 11/03 by 1 woman alleging he abused her daughter. This case settled for $2M. Diocese suing insurance co. for reimb. Ruling 5/13 in favor of insurance co.","Brooklyn, NY",NY,Source: NY Times 04.10.02
column15: NY Post 01.28.09 Assignments:Courthouse News Service 5.14.13 (add'l article)

column1: Smith,Leland J.,1953,P,Accused,41A031DB-AF87-11E3-8677-CFE8F69ED7FC,"Following a recent court order, on 12/16/13 Bp. Quinn released a list of 13 names of priests who had ""credible"" accusations of abuse involving minors. Smith's inclusion on this list is the first public notice that he had been accused of abuse. Diocese updated information on its list 6/23/14. Ministerial privileges indefinitely suspended in 1994 after Diocese received several complaints that he molested minor males. Completed treatment and was allowed to minister to elderly adults until new allegation received 2002. All of his privileges were removed again. Laicized 04/11/14.","Winona, MN",MN,Source: Albert Lea Tribune 12.16.13
column3: Diocese of Winona Statement and List of Accused Priests with Assignments 12.16.13
column6: Diocese of Winona Updated List & Media Statement 06.23.14
